description:
Excellent!
This is my favorite restaurant in the Financial District. Outstanding food and service. 
This is one of my first picks when making dinner plans. it has the perfect ambiance and quality for both business and personal.
author: David R.

description:
For one of my birthday dinners, I wanted steak. Made a reservation through OpenTable the day before for a party of 6 on Saturday, September 8th at 5:30pm. We were a party of 5 adults and 1 toddler.

*ONION RINGS ($13)
*JUMBO SHRIMP COCKTAIL OR REMOULADE ($18)
*MARYLAND-STYLE CRAB CAKE: With Honey Mustard Sauce ($19)
*FRIED CALAMARI: with Cocktail Sauce ($16)
*CAESAR SALAD: with Croutons ($14)
*Kid's Mac n' Cheese ($9)

Everyone just named an appetizer that they wanted and we ended up with the plates above. I'm a veggie girl, so I enjoyed the caesar. The onion rings are massive! You get a huge stack of them. The crab cake was kinda small for five to share, but since we had so many apps, cutting it up into a few servings was fine. The shrimp cocktail and calamari were pretty standard and tasty. They have a kid's menu, so the first thing we ordered was the mac n cheese. A pretty big serving for a kid sized meal. They give you complimentary bread and butter and jar of pickled cucumbers and red bell peppers, so make sure to sample that. I liked the pickles, but I found the peppers a little slimy.

STEAKS & CHOPS: All entrees are served with a glazed carrot and choice of baked potato, smashed potatoes or skillet fried potatoes which are topped with sautéed onions and peppercorn gravy
*PRIME RIBEYE: 14oz. ($49) x2
*PRIME "CÔTE DE BOEUF" BONE-IN RIBEYE: 22oz. ($62)
*PRIME FILET MIGNON: 9oz. ($49)
*PRIME T-BONE: 16oz. ($52)

*SAUTÉED MUSHROOMS ($11)
*FRESH ASPARAGUS ($11)
*ROASTED BRUSSELS SPROUTS ($10)

The bone in ribeye looked delicious! Definitely the most impressive looking steak. I got the 14oz ribeye which I found a little fatty at spots. The skillet potatoes were tasty and my fav out of the potato sides. I tried the mashed potatoes too and they had a good amount of garlic flavor. I'm not a huge fan of cooked carrots, so I left that alone. The sides were nice and simple. Asparagus and mushrooms are two of my favorite veggies, so I enjoyed those. I didn't try the brussels, but they looked good as well.

*BROWNIE SUNDAE: A Peanut Butter and Chocolate Brownie with Triple Chocolate and Peanut Butter Cup Ice Cream Topped with Pecan Chocolate Butter Nut Sauce, Whipped Cream and a Cherry
*Chandon Brut Classic ($15 glass)
*Cliff Lede Stags Leap District Cabernet Sauvignon 2014 ($145 bottle)

Since it was my bday, the restaurant gave us a complimentary dessert. If you are a chocolate lover, this is a good dessert to share as it's huge. The bottle of red wine we ordered waa nice and full bodied. Definitely went well with red meat. I started with a glass of bubbly as I was the first one here. Nice to sip on while waiting.

Service was weird. Our server asked us if we were ready to order and I said we'll order some apps. I started naming apps and he just walked away to help another table. So strange! We wanted to try the pickle jar with our apps, but he took that away without asking. I had to inquire later with our steaks to get the jar back.

I was ready to give this spot four stars, but due to the odd service, I'm bumping it down to three. Otherwise, a nice old school spot to grab a steak. And kid friendly.
author: Elena N.

description:
Wifeypie and I dined in the bar last night, the restaurant is being remodeled. 

Shrimp cocktail, a 5! Chopped salad, a 4. Filet Mignon sliders a 3-4. 

Based on that I would have given the place a 4 star review, but here's the kicker. I requested a little more horseradish for the shrimp cocktail, our server said sure. Then she brought a mountain of it, quite insane! We requested two different salad dressings and she informed us that there would be an additional charge for that. Well we wanted the two so what the hay! Honestly, I do not think they even charge you extra for additional salad dressings at a fast food establishment, nor have I ever been charged extra at any restaurant (fancy or casual) that I can recall.

The bill arrived and they charged two bucks for the extra salad dressing and an additional two bucks for the horseradish, which the server did not inform us of. Honestly, I wanted maybe a teaspoon more as there was very little on the cocktail. Keep in mind the prices at Bob's are not cheap to begin with but honestly, we felt this was just weird.  Is the four dollars gonna break me? Nahhhhhhhh. But still!

We stay at the Omni frequently and are platinum members (after this year we are very close to black status members) and always have drinks and apps at the bar, never have we encountered this behavior.  Is this typical or up to the discretion of the waitperson?

Hey, Bob! Wassup????????????????

Humbly submitted,

Moi and Moi
author: Dave L.

description:
I gotta tell ya...I had a pretty damn good lunch at Bob's this past week and was super surprised. I'd eaten there once before a couple years back and had the "executive lunch" which was a cool concept for those who wanted a quick red meat fix but, this time around seafood was the star of the show. 

I started with the hamachi sashimi which was garnished with edible flowers, and hackle back caviar. Lightly seared, slightly smoky and delicious. Next up was the hamachi collar which was cooked to perfection. Holy crap, it might have been the best collar I've eaten. Flavorful, well seasoned and rich. Lastly was the swordfish sandwich and side salad. For $20 bucks it's a great deal as the fish is lovely and plays well with the slaw and brioche bun. Yum. 

Check this place out and go alternative with seafood over the meats, you won't be disappointed.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Really good sliders and strong drinks. Great for networking, as it is quiet. Also not a bad place to watch games without being in an overly crowded place.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Been awhile since I've been back to Bob's.  Client lunch today was fabulous!  I had a wonderful Halibut on a bed of amazingly cooked spinach.  It's definitely the best spinach I've ever eaten.  The halibut was large and well made.  The whole potato's were also very good.
"I'll be back"
author: Conan P.

description:
Bob's gets 5 stars from me! Came here to have a birthday dinner with my boyfriend and the attention to detail at Bob's is amazing! I mentioned in the reservation that this would be a birthday meal and they were super attentive. At the end of our meal they even brought out a complimentary dessert with candles and sang happy birthday - I didn't ask them to do any of that.

Aside from the amazing service, the food was absolutely delicious. The steak - amazing, the potatoes, salad, sides, all of it was mouth watering.

Will definitely be back :) We honestly felt like royalty. Who doesn't love that?
author: Inci A.

description:
I will not give this restaurant more than a rating for these reasons: Anniversary dinner after seeing a superb Stravinsky symphony with opera at Davies Hall in San Francisco.
I ordered Filet Mignon with Lobster.  Filet was drenched in butter where I couldn't taste the meat.  Lobster was dry and tough.  It came with potatoes which they took away.  I ordered Rack of Lamb, which came back bloody and potatoes drenched in gravy.
Needless to say, left hungry and disappointed.  
I wrote 2 letters to General Manager (Adam Pickett) and to Omni Hotels and Resorts....only to get no response.
I normally only write good reviews, but for a Corporation to ignore a customer's order and inquiry is by far a disappointment.
author: Carson D.

description:
Bob's is always a great place to go anytime of the evening. The bar area is lively and you can order anything from the restaurant menu.  The bar has excellent wine choices and the staff is very friendly. 

Sheila is an amazing bartender who makes you feel right at home with her warm smile and friendly and positive attitude. If you don't like a cocktail or wine, she will make or pour another glass without hesitation. 

They do like to make larger potions when it comes to food and desserts, so it is a good idea to share - especially the chocolate cake. It's humongous!!
author: Lisa G.

description:
I don't understand why they put a huge pot of pickles on the table. I take a ribeye. At the first time, it was with a carrot as you can see on one picture and with onions on potatoes. All were mixed, I said to take off the carrot and put in other way, separate onions from other vegetables.
Knife can't cut the meat. I ask for a real knife. A manager came for this ! 
Finally, the beef is good cooking rare as I ordered and garbage are fresh.
The place is wonderful cosy.
If I will have possibilities, I will live in this Hotel also.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description:
Wasn't planning to come here, but original plans fell through and we passed by this place on the way back to the car and decided to give it a try. Thankfully we were able to get in without a reservation! 

Between the two of us, we decided to split an order of duck breast and an order of the rib-eye (smallest cut). The duck breast was amazing!!! Super tender. Cooked to a perfect medium-rare. And lots of flavor. I wish the pieces would have been sliced a little thinner, though. But so so good. We could have done without the rib eye and just gotten two orders of the duck. The rib-eye was ok. Wasn't as tender as I was expecting. Flavor was good, and it was quite the hefty slab of meat (even the smallest cut..which is what we ordered). We didn't end up finishing it. The mashed potatoes here are bomb. Very creamy and rich, so I was happy the dishes also came with some other veggies to help cut the grease/richness. 

Oh, and customer service here is awesome! Will definitely be back, and next time, it'll probably be planned :)
author: Ashley Y.

description: It was a wonderful business meal. The round booths were ideal for talking, the steak delicious and the carrot so soft it was almost like a sweet potato. The pickles on the table were u niwue and the fried lobster tail on point. It was a wonderful experience and great customer service.
author: Callaway M.

description:
Ok let me get this straight.  She complained that she didn't have all of her party and had to wait? And your important because you date the former mayor. Wow!!! All I can say is now I want to go there because the host showed balls and a WTF are you attitiude. Furthermore, you have gone there sooooo often you don't know the Asian hosts name who is always so nice. Sounds like you really know the staff lol. GTFOH!!!  Oh and you had a large glass of water! Well damn lets just give you a private room! Listen its a BUSINESS! Dating someone who is repsected in the city does not make you someone. Sorry sounds like your ego was brusied and you have a brittle soul. I'm sure the doors won't close from your review and won't stay open because of your vast water consumption. 

Well done sir. Continue the good work. For the record, I dine and drink at far more restraunts than she does  based on her review, I will be sure to pass along the good word.
author: Michael S.

description:
I love this place! The food is consistent and the staff is friendly. It's one of the best steak houses in the city. 

I haven't reviewed in years and why now? Well I'm tired of seeing over privileged people bashing great restaurants because they think they have the power to. Especially the ones who hang out with an ex mayor (keyword Ex.) The whole review sounds ridiculous and one sided. It's funny how they said that the host was exercising there power when in fact you were trying to use your so called power especially since you had no reservations. For someone who eats out often you should know that just because there might be some empty seats doesn't mean there not reserved. As well as knowing that some restaurants when they're  busy you can't be seated unless your whole party is there!
author: Ness C.

description: I am not a famous person, but I am an honest one.  I have worked across the street from Bob's Steak & Chop House for 13 years.  I've stayed at the Omni Hotel during trials too.  I have eaten at the restaurant and in the bar so many times, I've lost count.  One of the reasons I eat at Bob's and stay at the Omni Hotel is because when I'm tired, hungry and missing my family due to my work schedule or need good food, Bob's and the Omni Hotel treat me like family.  I know people that work there by name and they make me feel at home.  When tourists or visiting attorneys/staff ask me where they can get a great steak, I send them to Bob's.  Things happen.  It is time for people to stop being in their feelings and be a little more forgiving.  You be the judge of the food and the service.  I am and will forever be a Bob's customer!  I hope you will be too!
author: Liz M.

description:
This review is more about the bar section of Bob's Steak & Chop House at the Omni hotel than it is about the restaurant section.  I have eaten at both, but more at the bar than I do the restaurant as there are so many other places to eat in San Francisco and it would be a waste of a trip to SF to only eat there.  I have been coming to SF for business for many years, too many for me to even mention.  But that isn't the point of this review.  It about Bob's Steak & Chop House Bar section and restaurant section.  I will first go into the restaurant section.  I have eaten breakfast there and I have finally had dinner there on my last trip.  The breakfast is what it says it is.  A good breakfast cooked to order.  The dinner there was very good.  The steak was cooked correctly to temp and the sides were tasty.  Selection of alcohol is pretty substantial and the wait staff was on point the night I was there.  I would give the dinner/breakfast side 4.5 stars.

Now the reason why I am writing this review.  It for the bar section.  As you may have read from my other reviews, I love burgers.  Not just burgers, but GREAT burgers.  Burgers that are "JAB" (just another burger) gets called out here regularly.  Well, the burger at Bob's Steak & Chop House isn't JAB!  By far, one of the best burgers I have ever had in my entire life if not the best.  It boils down to one reason.  Quality of the hamburger used.  They use the cuttings from their steaks to fresh grind their hamburger meat every day.  So you are getting meat from the prime rib cuttings and other fine cuts of meat.  And you can taste it.  The meat is well seasoned and cooked to perfection.  I order my burger medium with minimal accompanying additions to taste the meet and it was cooked medium.   When I suggested the burger this past trip to a gentleman at the bar, he ordered his medium rare and he raved about the burger, his eyes rolled back like he had just had a taste of manna.  Last year on a trip to SF, I was sitting at the bar having one of their delicious burgers and a co-worker stopped by.  I raved about the burger and picked up his tab and he ordered himself one.  The burger was so nice he had a 2nd one the next day instead of leaving to go to a restaurant.  They have really large onion rings which are tasty an seasoned with salt and pepper.  They are fresh large vidalia onions.  Their regular French fries are also tasty.  I believe that I have had at least three burgers on my multiple stays at the Omni and each one has been fantastic.  They have pop corn shrimp for a play on fish and chips with they call it shrimp and chips which I also order with their regular fries, they have wedges, but those are not my cup of tea.  For that burger alone, I would give them 5 stars, but the bar staff is extremely friendly and attentive.   Small seating area at the bar, but again, the burger is fantastic.

All in all, if you are looking for a fantastic burger, I highly recommend Bob's Steak & Chop House and sitting in the bar area and ordering up one of these Prime burgers.
author: L H.

description: I went to Bob's last night with 4 friends.  Starting with the good part: the steaks were fine and cooked as ordered.  Sadly everything else was just meh.... nothing special.  Maybe because the restaurant is in the Omni hotel downtown and they have a captive audience, they feel they don't have to try that hard.  Whatever the case, it was a disappointing experience.  Service was slow and inattentive.  The atmosphere feels tired and old.  And the rest of the food was a bit bland and uninventive.  For the price, you can definitely do better.  I know there are great steak houses in SF.  This is not one of them.
author: Rob E.

description:
I have one word, "large."
Second time lunching there. Had the 22 oz. rib eye medium well, Oscar style. It was hit with a wonderful Hollandaise, lumps of crab on top, all on a bed of tender asparagus. Aged to perfection. I need another one! Worth every penny!
author: Andrea F.

description: Great place for a business breakfast!  Fantastic service, Smoothie shots.  Great old school San Francisco feel!
author: Cari J.

description:
My boyfriend and I first went to Bob's Steakhouse down in Carlsbad at La Costa. We had sub-par experience because my fish dish was not good and the service wasn't amazing either. As a yelp elite, I wrote a review and the General Manager Melanie reached out to me to apologize for my experience and offer us to come back to Bob's for another try. That was the best customer service I've ever received! Of course I took her up on it, but asked to go to the San Francisco location instead as I live here. She was able to accommodate and let the folks at Bob's in SF know about our experience down at La Costa, which provided for a great experience.

We arrived at 8pm on a Friday and the hostess apologized for our experience at La Costa, and offered us free champagne! Our waitress, Shelley, was super friendly and accommodating. Offered us great recommendations on wine and food, but also gave us space when we weren't ready to decide. We ended up getting a bottle of Meiomi Pinot Noir from California, which was really smooth. Shelly let us try that wine and another Pinot before deciding which one we wanted to chose.

For food, we started with the mix green salad which they split for us into two plates. My boyfriend LOVED it because it's all of his favorite things. I liked it a lot as well. For my main dish, I got the 9 oz filet steak with a side of smashed potatoes. 9 oz is definitely enough for me, it was huge! There was a little mishap where my steak was switched on the plate with my boyfriend's (I got medium rare and he got medium), but we figured it out and were able to switch. The smashed potatoes were delicious. Super creamy and buttery (clearly unhealthy but very tasty). The glazed carrot was not my thing (I don't like carrots), but my boyfriend LOVED it. We also got a side of brussels sprouts with bacon, which were actually kind of dry so I wouldn't order them again.

Overall, I had a great experience at Bob's and was so thankful that Melanie invited us back to try it again. Definitely the best customer service I have experienced.
author: Jenna G.

description:
Found this place by accident. Me and my group went to an Italian place around the corner that was horrible so we decided to walk somewhere else to eat. Walking down the street we team into this place. Menu looked great and so did the atmosphere. We decided to try it and glad we did. Everything about this place was great awesome steaks, bread, and service. We will defiantly be returning to this place in the future. 

This is an upscale restaurant great place to have a nice quite dinner. 
Thank you.
author: Chris H.

description: Excellent service. It has that old steak house feel from back in the old days. Rich wood decor, masculine feel. White table cloths and the menu is amazing! Only the finest cuts of beef served here to perfection! I had the New York strip and it was delicious! You have to try the smashed potatoes and the calamari too. Had the spinach and mushrooms on the side and awesome wine list to pair with your dinner. Worth the reservation and also not cheap but fine dinning quality! A treat for sure! Great for business dinners too.
author: Maureen M.

description:
Wonderful steak. My daughter and I both had the filet which was tender and flavorful. Just the right amount of char for me. 

And because I love blue cheese, I had to have the wedge salad. Perfect!!!
author: Joy T.

description:
Traditional steakhouse environment with white table clothes and old school waiters. Came here for breakfast (though I've been to other Bob's for dinner) and found it rather lacking. Now, it's the hotel's breakfast spot so I suppose you should expect prices to be higher than should be but I did find ~$35/person to be quite a lot for what was barely better than diner fare. 

The corned beef hash was a substantial portion. The corned beef itself was okay and I did appreciate they were using relatively larger chunks of meat and it wasn't some sort of ground meat, but it wasn't very impressive. The potatoes also weren't very crispy. In fact I was expecting something in the whole dish to be crispy if it's a hash but there was no bite. 

Coffee was $6 which for the quality seemed outrageous though once again this is a hotel hostage type situation I suppose.

Service was great and attentive.
author: Victor W.

description: The steak was cooked to perfection. The mash potatoes - awesome.  The staff was polite and responsive buuuuut the carrot that was served with my filet could have been displayed a little nicer.
author: Todd B.

description: This place is great.  Don't let other *lengthy* reviews steer you away.  I have dined here many times and had amazing food AND even better service.
author: Bryce D.

description: Dined here the other night with a friend. Excellent service, nice staff and great food. This wasn't a planned dinner but they were able to find a cozy spot for us. The hostess made sure we are comfortable at our table and happy. Very attentive server-answered all of our questions about food options, wine preferences and was just sweet all around. Excellent food, excellent service and just a wonderful place. The steaks were prepared the way we wanted them-medium-rare, juicy and tender! Definitely coming back and bringing my friends for my birthday get-together.
author: Valentina P.

description: It was a decent meal, but just that. We really enjoyed the spinach salad, and my fish was delicious. The boyfriend's steak was good not great, the side we ordered (spinach and mushrooms) was bland, and dessert (cheesecake and some kind of bread pudding) was nothing to write home about. Extra star for the heavy pour at the bar, which led to a great tip! Same can't be said for the server who treated us like we were nothing customers to him (maybe because we're young?). I'd recommend saving your money or trying a different steakhouse.
author: Bailey D.

description: Stayed at the La Costa Omni for a quick golf trip and wanted to eat close by.  This restaurant is on property and was amazing!  The food was great, the service was first class.  Our group thoroughly enjoyed our meal and time at the Omni.  Would definitely return!
author: Lori M.

description: Love having Bob's in the Hotel. Great bar and great food. I would give them 5 stars if their drinks weren't so expensive. I love that they have nuts snacks at the bar to munch on while you enjoy a cocktail or a glass of wine. We popped in after sushi for a night cap. Had a nice red blend and met a gentleman who used to work there who had this giant half order of the most amazing looking onion rings I've ever seen. He kindly gave us one to try and I tell you, it was the best onion ring I've ever had. Which sucks because back at home I can just walk across the golf course to Bob's to grab an order! So light and flaky, I think they put beer in the batter. Huge, thinly sliced onions. My bf did order a bowl of chili with sour cream and cheese of course. It was very sweet with nice shredded chunks of meat and no beans which I like. Maybe a bit too sweet, could have used some hot sauce to cut that. Clean old school, nice staff and I just love the Omni and everything about it.
author: Valerie M.

description: We were in the area yesterday morning and we decided to try out the breakfast.  My wife needs to move slowly with a walker.  We arrived at the hostess station and made a bit of small talk with her.  She was about to seat us, but then she looked at her watch and announced that it was 10 am and that we would have to come back another time.  I didn't make a fuss at the time, since this gave me a great excuse to take my wife over to Venue Cafe for a great breakfast that would set us back about $50 less.  Still, the hostess handled the situation very badly.  Maybe she didn't see the big picture, maybe she was more interested in taking a coffee break than accommodating a pair of locals, or maybe she was just just following management guidelines to keep seniors with walkers out of sight.  No matter how good the food may have been, rudeness always leaves a bad taste in one's mouth.
author: Dean L.

description:
I'm serious about my breakfast, and so are these guys. Love the size of their plates!
I tried the eggs Benedict twice, absolutely fabulous both times. Didn't love the potatoes it came with tough, wish it had been a has brown instead.  
Waffles and pancakes are good too, bacon sides are very, very crispy.
author: Camilla J.

description: The fillet mignon is the best ! Ask for a bigger portion n u will in love ! N the onion ring is amazing
author: Christie D.

description: Just went here for a snack during the middle of the day had sliders with filet mignon they were amazing and we had the banana nut bread putting with rum sauce to die for ,,, The best part about this restaurant is the candy bowl out front they have sourballs on them we cannot stop eating,,  Who doesn't love free candy lol
author: Mike V.

description: Yes, it's pricey but it's five star across the board. It's one my favorites in SFO and DFW. I go simple. Excellent wine and spirits selection and service cannot be outdone. Last night I had the 9oz filet oopah! Fine beef wonderfully prepared and served with perfect baked potato. I prefaced it with a classic wedge salad: bacon bits great and baptized in heavenly blue cheese; an entree in itself.  I'm a customer for life and encourage you to be one too!
author: Dale P.

description:
I came here for lunch to catch up with my professor. He recommended that we come to this place because the food is good, service is excellent, and there is never a wait during lunch time in the heart of Financial District. This place is inside Omnia Hotel but you can enter from the street on California and Montgomery.

The service here is excellent. Our waiter was polite and respectful and made sure he never interrupted us in a middle of a conversation. It was not overbearing at all.

I decided to go for Bob's Cob Salad. The salad is huge and it is literally two meals! You get to choose which dressing you want and I chose the vinaigrette. You also get to decide if you want dungeneous crab or grilled chicken breast and of course, i went for the crab. The crab is the same price as the chicken so that is a plus! 

Overall, I would definitely come back. It is a perfect quiet place for a business meeting or for a nice meal.
author: Allie Y.

description:
The food was very disappointing. I selected this steakhouse at the recommendation of our concierge. Based on prices, upwards of $50 per plate, I was looking forward to a top notch steakhouse. Their food seems more like something you get at sizzlers. 
The bread... mediocre. Giant loaf for two people, tasteless.
The Chophouse Salad, I think Subway's chopped salad comes to mind. They asked if we wanted thousand island or ranch dressing... not what you should expect from a high end restaurant. 
Clam chowder soup... I took three spoonfuls and left the bowl virtually untouched. It was the worst I have ever had. 
The steak, filet mignon... very chewy, swimming in butter and lacking in flavor. 
The skillet fried potatoes... would have been much better without the glob of gravy out of a can.

Super disappointed because I had high expectations.
author: Philippe M.

description: $$$$$Good food love it. will come back thank you for the good service the carrot would have been better if it didn't have that sweet sauce on it
author: Joel E.

description:
Inside omni hotel.
Open to last minute reservations.
Still pretty busy for the lunch rush, dinning room gets filled with business men dressed in suits.
Classic steak house ambiance, white table cloth with excellent bow tie waiter service.
Lobster Mac & Cheese is not impressive, tastes like regular Mac & cheese with a few pieces of lobster on top. 
Seafood options are also fantastic here- ask for specials of the day.
author: Azizi A.

description: I am staying at the Omni hotel for business and the restaurant for the hotel is Bobs Steak & Chop House.  I ordered a Cabernet and the steak and blue salad. The lettuce was wilted and the tomato was old and squishy.  Very disappointed.
author: Teri C.

description:
We were really impressed with the food and service here. This was our first meal upon arriving to San Francisco (we stayed at the Omni) and our experience could not have been better. 

We started with the bread and split a wedge salad. The bread was served quickly and was warm, soft, and chewy, just the way we like it! The wedge was delicious as well.

We really liked our entrees. My husband and I both ordered the filet with the scallops. We both thought our meals were tasty. The filets were juicy and flavorful. The scallops were wonderful as well. My son ordered the kid's chicken tenders, and he really enjoyed his meal too. 

We were already thinking about dessert half way through our meal. My son and I thought the carrot cake sounded great. We were surprised how big our slice of cake was when it arrived. This piece was huge! The cake was delicious as well. One of the better pieces of carrot cake we'd had in a while.

The service was great here too. The food was brought out fairly quickly, and they made sure to check on us often. Everyone was so nice and helpful here. 

For a wonderful meal in the financial district, Bob's Steak and Chop House is a good stop when visiting the area. The food and service were great here!
author: Tami D.

description: Food matches awesome ambiance and superb service. The stake on par with the best I've ever had with experience that lures back. Hopefully soon!
author: G S.

description: Five of us had dinner here on Thursday evening. 3 out of 5 had food poisoning. Onion rings need dipping sauce. Food tasted fine otherwise but who cares when your blowing at both ends a few hours later.
author: Trevor D.

description:
This was a last minute pick in China town.
It was 8:30 and we wanted steak and seafood.
It was a generous portion for the meat and sides.
I order the salmon meal my friends got steak and duck. It came with a broil carrot and your choice of side. I enjoyed the experience.
Average bill was 40-50 just for meal no extras.
I would go back as the service was fast, food was reasonably priced and good.
author: Tina D.

description:
Lunch time craze in the Financial District! 

Perfectly nestled on the corner of California & Montgomery lays Bob's Steak & Chophouse. This place is the Financial Districts's hidden lunchtime gem. 

Great service 
Generous portions
Tons of options 
A little pricey 

Did I mention you can top off any meal with foie gras or fresh crab? 

Hit up the bar and check out their sandwich of the week. This week I had the Sam Adams Octoberfest Beer Braised Short Rib Sandwich!! Ahhh-mazing. 

At this rate, I'll never get my abs back!
author: Anna T.

description:
Sometimes simple is good.
Wanting to dine here for quite a while, I chose this centrally located Financial District restaurant for a business lunch on a recent weekday.  Being in the Omni Hotel, the restaurant is visible from the street on the ground floor and its entrance is from inside of the hotel.  Arriving early, I was seated at a mid-room table for four though we were only a party of two.  I studied the menu and waited to hear my lunch companion's comments or advice before deciding on my meal.  The menu is relatively large for a steakhouse as they have seafood and other options. After our waiter explained the business lunch special, it was an easy decision.  Since the soup of the day was cream of mushroom (love them shroooms), my meal consisted of a wedge salad, mushroom soup, Filet Mignon medium rare, and crème brulee (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=j55ekn9P2ICcfoXtLayMtw&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) (counterclockwise from bottom left).  Everything was executed well and I surprisingly enjoyed the wedge salad (not a blue cheese fan).  Asked the waiter whether the soup was available for takeout but sadly he said no; the garlic crouton added some bite to the soup.  The portions were perfect as I was full and satisfied yet not overly so.
My friend had a regular meal portion of the filet mignon which came with only one side.
For the price (under $40.00), this meal is reasonable, given the number of courses (four) and the food quality.  There are quite a few steak houses in the area, three within a six block radius now so competition is stiff.
Yes, I will be back and maybe splurge on a dinner here.  Lunch definitely works for me!
author: Mike C.

description: The food was OK but it took us forever to get an order in, and we never got the box we asked for when time ran short. The hostess was nice enough to take our order when nobody else came by. Not a good experience but would try again and hope it was a fluke.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Decent steak, but not worth the price. Dinner for four and a bottle of wine will run you 300 bucks. We didn't get waited on for 10 minutes after sitting down, the wrong bottle of wine was brought to the table, the server forgot our appetizer, we filled our own glasses twice. The steaks and salads were good, topped with the peppercorn gravy was the highlight of the meal, but not mind blowing. My wife's broccoli was deep fried in tempura and tasted more like a hush puppy. The bread was baked so hard you had to cut the outside with a steak knife. Won't go back.
author: Matthew R.

description:
Excellent traditional Steakhouse. We each chose their bone-in ribeye, which was served by George-an excellent server and good humored gentleman. Steaks were delicious and flavorful, baked potato was perfectly cooked. I was not a fan of the glazed carrot served with the steak. It had a cloying sweetness from cinnamon and sugar glaze which reminded me of carrots prepared for a child's palate. They added nothing to the steak and confused the delicate flavors of the older french bordeaux I brought to enjoy. Mushrooms were pedestrian. Nothing much was added to enhance their flavor-a simple butter and garlic sauté-with too much water leeched into the sauce from the saute.
Still, I gave it a 5. Steak was dry aged and prepared perfectly and the service was equally good. We came in at 5 pm opening on our way to a Giants' game at AT&T Park. They were perfectly accommodating and supportive of our time frames.
Thank you, George!
author: Bill R.

description:
I had high expectations for this steak house because it's in the SF FiDi area. 

I've only been here once and I feel that this steak house is super overpriced and mediocre tasting.
author: Alice X.

description: A wonderful evening. My server was extremely knowledgable regarding the wine list and once I had narrowed it down to two she graciously arranged for us to sample them. I would highly recommend dinner or even stop by for lunch. The ribeye steak is so large it can be divided for two and the Frank Family Zinfandel is the best!
author: Julie G.

description:
Very, very good pork chop.  I had high expectations since "chop house" is in the name, and the dish didn't disappoint.  The thick cut of chop was tender, juicy, and flavorful.

I came here with a large group, and while waiting for food to arrive, some changed seats to talk to different people. This game of musical chairs failed to confuse the wait staff - they got the right plates to the right people without interrupting our conversations. 

It is perhaps because we had a large group that the food was a little slow to arrive. I was starved, and decided to open the pickle jar on the table that many thought was just decor. Bad idea. The pickles was the only item in this meal I didn't love.
author: Jack L.

description:
Bob's presented my husband and me with the single best dining experience we've ever had. If this restaurant suffers from inconsistency, I couldn't tell you, because the food and service were spot-freaking-on the evening we visited. 

The restaurant is, as others have already pointed out, resident of the Omni Hotel on California @ Montgomery. Price-wise, it's a rung beneath Morton's; entrees alone will set you back about $40-65, and DO inquire what "market price" is as suggested on the menu, because it's more than you'd hope. The digital wine menu is convenient, but I kinda miss the sommelier schooling me rather than swiping left to read the Vinu tasting notes. I digress. 

I noted booth seating in my reservation request, which is always a gamble. Padded bench seating with a row of traincar tables isn't a booth, but many higher-end restaurants would like you to believe communal dining is progressive and interesting and that we need to reinstate the social interaction element of dining out. No. Bars exist for that purpose, no? Lucky for me, my request was granted and we were seated off in a private booth with no neighbors thus no hypervigilant honing-in on others' trite conversations (on my part obviously).

Our server was quick, sliding into our little enclave at all of the right moments. We never felt forgotten, and more importantly we never felt rushed; a terrific palette-cleanser following the previous evening's dining debacle. She accommodated my husband's request to reheat his filet after it had cooled - you can't, shouldn't, inhale a filet. The Maryland crab cakes were stand-alone amazing: crispy, not minced too finely (a few rogue crab chunks separated from the patty, I'll take it!) and never mushy. They didn't need any condiments, let alone the honey mustard glaze they were drizzled with. NOTHING was deluged in seasoned drawn butter. NOTHING was greasy, over-cooked, over-salted. Not a mark was missed. It was just a perfect meal that we dreaded finishing so we cushioned the blow with port because they were out of limoncello.
author: Julianna O.

description: Great food and exceptional service. Tried the mixed greens salad, with sliced pecans and apples. Just perfect amount of cheese and vinaigrette dressing. Chef sent us a seasonal fruit desert, tasted delicious. Overall a great spot for a quick business lunch.
author: Anisha Y.

description:
Went to a 3 day seminar at the Omni hotel where this restaurant is located. I had breakfast here all three days. Two of the days were fantastic and one of the days was not very good.

Here's my experience . . . On the first day, I had a waitress named Natalie. Not only was she friendly, but super professional and on top of things.  The eggs Benedict was outstanding. In addition to the eggs benedict, there were some very good fried potatoes, a shot glass of strawberry smoothie, and a little chocolate cake.  The coffee was rich and smooth.  Excellent breakfast and worth the $32.   

On the second day, I had another waiter (and maybe another chef?) and the food was not as good. The eggs benedict lacked sufficient hollandaise sauce (very dry) and this time, no sweet bite of cake or the little smoothie.  I had to ask for a little more hollandaise and they charged me an extra $2 for it. This made me a little angry as I was spending $30 for breakfast yet didn't get the same great meal as previously - and I had to pay extra? The $6 Coffee service was also not as prompt. I certainly didn't feel like it was a special breakfast. Oh, and I forgot to mention that as a single female dinner who had tipped very well the previous morning, I was stuck in the corner near the kitchen. (Although the restaurant was empty) However, later on, a single male came in and was seated at one of the window tables. Hmmm . . . All in all, a very disappointing experience.

On the third day, I requested to be seated in Natalie's section, and Lo and behold, the breakfast was outstanding (was given all the little extras) and the eggs benedict had plenty of hollandaise sauce. Coffee was kept flowing and it was a great experience. Based on days one and three, I would have given this five stars.

Bottom line, the food was excellent, but the service was spotty. If you can, request Natalie. She's the best waitress at this restaurant and will make sure your meal and experience are great.

As for lunch and dinner, I have no idea if they're any good, but based on their breakfast, I would guess those meals to be excellent as well.
author: Anne J.

description: Yesterday I came in with a friend to celebrate her birthday. The steak tartare was a wonderful appetizer to start with and was followed by filet entrees. Cooked to perfection! I love coming here and the food and service, is always spot on. See y'all soon!
author: Roger G.

description:
Last night, I ordered 6 crunchy onion rings and ate them all.   That's how tasty they are. The batter is different than the typical batter - it's Bob's secret recipe. The rings are between 3-4 inches in diameter - a yummy size. My favorite part is that they're not greasy (one of my pet peeves is greasy fried food).  

Of course,  I had to accompany my rings with ketchup and a diet Coke - unhealthy food seems to always taste better accompanied by a diet Coke. 

The service is great - the restaurant is highly attentive. The hostess offered and bought me the newspaper, one attendant brought me warm bread and butter, and yet another attendant brought me a jar of their pickled bell peppers and pickles. Yum - the pickled red bell peeped are new to me.  

I recommend Bob's and the onion rings. Enjoy.
author: Lolita T.

description:
I've been to Bob's 3 times. Once shortly after they opened (I remember so well the whole building being gutted while they built out the Omni), a few weeks ago, and tonight for my birthday.
The first visit was just ok. It was about 5 or 6 years ago, so I remember it being ok, but nothing special. So, I didn't return.
I met the wife and some friends at the Omni recently for an event and we decided to dine at Bob's and I was very pleasantly surprised. The long and the short of it is my filet was awesome.
Tonight, after some deliberations about where to go for my birthday, I actually selected Bob's. That should't sound so incredulous to most folks, however I can afford to go anywhere I want (yes I realize I am lucky and I appreciate that more than most who seem to take it for granted). I was so impressed with my filet though that I opted to go back to Bob's. 
I made the right choice. Our server is a really friendly guy from Sacramento and he was a lot of fun. I brought in a superb bottle of wine that we chatted about endlessly and it did not disappoint. The meal though was definitely excellent. 
My wife, believe it or not, is a vegetarian, so they got her salads wrong not once but twice, but they were apologetic and corrected it quickly. I understand though, because this is not the kind of place vegetarians hang out in. So, easily forgiven as far as I'm concerned. 
I ordered the filet mignon again (this time the huge 16 oz. size) and I was most definitely NOT disappointed. That steak is absolutely divine. It is Prime, so it's among the best cuts you can get. The only difference between the great steakhouses is how they prepare the meat.
Bob's does it right. They do something to char the exterior of the meat while maintaining the juiciness and full flavor of the beef. This is steak candy. Seriously excellent beef, and I've dined at most of the famous steakhouses in the country so I think I can say this is awesome with some degree of confidence. 
For a birthday treat they brought me a chocolate cake that was totally bomb. It was not light, it was a decadent chocolate cake loaded with chocolate chips, but it was totally perfect.
So, if you're not seeking what may be the most memorable steak dinner of your life, or necessarily the best steak house experience you've ever had, Bob's may fit the bill. It is excellent in most ways, but isn't a Hall of Famer. If you're looking for an excellent steak though in a town known more for ethnic varieties, you could do a lot worse than Bob's, Bon Appetit.
author: Matt H.

description: Wonderful! Thick juicy steaks! Great add ins! Add to this great wines! What's not to dislike?
author: Gary H.

description:
By far the juiciest prime rib I've ever had! 
Medium rare- served with a truffle butter, just how I like it. The crab cake is all crab, no fillings and is absolutely pure goodness! The servers are great and very attentive.  Will be back for my Birthday!
author: Jon L.

description:
LOCATION: This restaurant is inside a hotel. Very hard to find a parking spot. Took us almost 15 minutes at 7:15pm to find one almost 3 blocks away. We got lucky. WE PARKED NEAR TARGET. 

AMBIENCE: Quaint with good lighting. 

APPETIZER: Shrimp Platter (Yummy but basic. It came with 6 jumbo shrimps. With different dressings.) 

HUSBAND'S PLATE: Filet Mignon (12oz) and Smashed Potato 
(My husband's opinion of his food, "Steak is tender and juicy and cooked perfectly BUT very BLAND. I needed to add salt to my steak. That's a big NO-NO. But I had to to make it taste better. The smashed potato was just good. I've had better. And it's very garlicky."

MY PLATE: Prime Ribeye (12oz) and Baked Potato 
(My prime Ribeye was actually pretty delicious. It was tender and juicy. The taste was simple but I kinda like it that way. The baked potato was just a regular baked potato with all the fixings. The waiter will come to your table to offer you bacon, chives, cheese, and sour cream.) 

SIDE: Sautéed Mushrooms (Jumbo mushrooms sautéed with some sort of balsamic vinegar. It was good but we weren't impressed. Just okay.) 

OVERALL EXPERIENCE: Kinda DISAPPOINTED. We thought we would have the best steaks here but was very disappointed. They charge way too much for just average food.
author: Jacqueline P.

description: Excellent excellent excellent! We had lunch here and the food and service was great. We ordered the calamari, club sandwich, shrimp blackened pasta and creme brûlée. The shrimp pasta was to die for!!! A must visit.
author: Brooklyn J.

description:
Had a business dinner here last Monday. In spite of being inside the Omni hotel, it is not your typical hotel restaurant. 

My piece de resistance was the 9oz filet mignon medium rare. It was perfect. The service was impeccable, the wine list robust. If you want a steak dinner experience in San Francisco you will not be disappointed
author: Massimo M.

description: Fancy steakhouse in the Omni hotel. Lovely decor and ambiance and decent service. The wine list is extensive and fairly expensive, but our pricey bottle was very, very good. The food was all very good, though the crab and Hollandaise on my Oscar style filet mignon was a bit salty. The shrimp sampler platter appetizer was excellent and the steak itself, as well as the skillet potatoes and veggies on the side were super tasty. The price was pretty high, but overall the quality of the food made it mostly worth it.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
So here's a place that could be so much more, but is ruined by service and emotional/bad attitude staff. Typically, when I'm here there's this lovely blonde woman with pretty blue eyes that is a joy to have as our server. Today, however, was one of those days that 1 bad attitude is the reason I will not go back. There are hundreds of restaurants in this city, and as a chronic corporate diner I only choose to bring my guests to the best places. My client and I showed up to the restaurant around 11:10. We were not told by the 3-4 staff members walking around and prepping the place that it didn't open till 11:30. Fine and good, we Googled it and realized we were wrong and early so we would just wait. Fast forward to 11:30, the bartender and waitress never once said anything to us. Then people started to enter the restaurant. The first table of 3 sat directly next to us. The waitress immediately brought them menus and served then drinks.... okay... so we figured she would approach us next. Nope. Kept right on acknowledging every other patron that entered the bar. We finally left at 11:45 after being ignored for so long. 
It's sad. I checked my expense reports for the year and I have spent over 1K at this place during first quarter. I do not intend on returning.
author: Shanna B.

description:
I should have known that Bob's is a Texas-based chain since there is something atypically non-Californian about the place once you enter. It's in the Omni where I have been to far too many work-related events of late, and indeed what took me here was a work-related lunch. Even though there are photos of vintage San Francisco on the wall, they might as well have framed photos of oil wells and rodeos instead for the carnvivore-heavy vibe in here (photo: http://bit.ly/NIT6gt). It's all about meat in here and the suits who love it. Now there is a Seafood of the Day and a Vegetarian Club Sandwich, but you might as well get up and leave if you don't have protein in mind. For me, the Steak Sandwich would do me just fine.

Although exorbitantly priced at $23, it was a mighty thick slab of grilled flatiron steak with blue cheese, arugula, pickled red onions, and saffron aioli slathered onto a potato ciabatta roll (photo: http://bit.ly/1jJVwGU). It was hearty, rib-sticking meat and good quality for sure, though the execution was pretty standard with little creative flair even for a steakhouse. As my side, I went for a Caesar Salad which came festooned with croutons in a small soup bowl (photo: http://bit.ly/1eFD1CR).It was fairly cafeteria-level when I think of the ways it could have complemented the meat on my plate. But instead of focusing on that, I downed an $8 Arnold Palmer since it was all on an expense account anyway (photo: http://bit.ly/NISyai).

FOOD - 3 stars...a liberal cut of steak for a red state-originated chain but the presentation was strictly by-the-numbers
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...and just who shot J.R.?
SERVICE - 3 stars...business cordial
TOTAL - 3 stars...if you want to eat expensive meat in your power suit, well here you go
author: Ed U.

description: I've been to most the steakhouses in the area and this is my favorite so far. It's nicely lit. Bone in ribeye and good wine with good company and a friendly waiter! Their signature stewed carrot is really tasty.
author: Jeremy J.

description:
Located on California and Montgomery in the heart of the financial district inside the Omni Hotel, I decided to come here and have a great steak and I was not disappointed.  We decided to valet park for $15 instead of hunting around for street parking which might have been possible given the business district of the neighborhood in the evening.  The valet seem surprised that we were dining at the restaurant instead of checking into the Omni.  

The lobby of the Omni is stunning.  Not large, but impressive.  Bob's is off to the side next to Montgomery Street and smaller than I anticipated.  As we dined, I got the impression that given the number of families dining there and the casual attire of the diners, that most of the diners were hotel guests.  

The service was excellent.  You start off with their marinated red peppers or pickles and then they serve you this huge dome of bread with butter.  The bread was the only real disappointment of the evening.  It was right out of the oven but really wasn't that tasty.  

Bob's made up for it with a perfectly grilled ribeye bone in marbled steak with a incredibly tasty salt and pepper crust.  Could be one of the best steaks I've ever had.  The carrot was huge and very tasty.  Nice job with the baked potato with everything.  I started the meal off with Manhattan seafood chowder and it was excellent.  The huge heirloom tomato and red onion was vinagrette was good too.  

Polished off everything with their huge brownie and ice cream.  Yum.  Everything was super tasty and came in a sizeable portion.  Had to take almost half my dinner home and most of the dessert as well.

Forgot to validate my valet parking, but the valet ran back inside to do it for me.  Thanks!  

Pretty pricey here, but with my left overs, I got two meals out of one.  How's that for rationalization?
author: Doctor G.

description: I came here for my last meal of 2016 to end the year off with a proper meal that would've been memorable and the outcome was delicious! I ordered the rack of lamb which was absolutely scrumptious! The meal was a large portion so if you're going to order it, make sure you are hungry!  I also ordered a side of brussels sprouts, which was great but one problem that I faced was there was bacon inside of the brussels sprouts which was not disclosed in the description when you order it, and I am allergic to pork. Overall, the food was amazing and I would definitely see myself coming back to this restaurant.
author: Mo I.

description:
I have high expectations for a steak restaurant with high prices. Though I don't eat steak frequently, I love a good steak. We met a few friends staying at the Omni hotel where the steakhouse is located.  

The bottled pickled veggies at the table were a nice touch. The bf and I decided to split a medium rare prime rib meal that came with smashed potatoes and a very large glazed carrot. We also ordered a side of sautéed spinach and mushrooms. The presentation of the steak dinner was ok, though I thought the plate looked odd with a huge carrot in the center. As for the ribeye, it was not cooked to order and was pretty rare. Most of the meat has pieces of fat. Another guest had the same issue with her steak being undercooked.

Our server was friendly but seemed to disappear as it took awhile and a second reminder of drink orders. The busboys were pretty good about keeping waters filled.
author: Nova P.

description: Dinner here was delicious. The price was reasonable for the amount of food that was served. I recommend purchasing a bottle of wine with your meal.
author: Marlene A.

description:
I chose Bob's to celebrate my wedding anniversary, and I was not disappointed. After setting the reservation a day prior, my wife and I was given a private booth in the restaurant that had two black & white framed pictures of San Francisco circa 1940 (one of which was the GG bridge). The customer service was outstanding. Our server attending to our every need and was very accommodating with other requests, such as taking a few couples photos. 

Prior to the appetizers being brought out (a 6-piece shrimp dish), we were served with a very, VERY large ball of bread along with quite a large pat of butter. The entrees were in very large proportions as well (the 1/2 roasted duck for me and the salmon dish for her). Yet strangely enough, the side dishes were remarkably very large. There was a side of broccoli that I could not even touch (it took up the entire plate) and the potatoes + carrot side order that came with both of our entrees were in very large proportions as well.

The server offered us dessert, yet there was absolutely no way that we could finish. Ultimately, we couldn't finish a good portion of the entire entrée assortments due to how large the proportions were, which is a good thing. Nonetheless, the experience and the quality of food at this venue was remarkable, making the anniversary celebration that more memorable.
author: Eric T.

description: Went here with high hopes of a real good steak unfortunately when I got my bone in ribeye I swear it was a bone in New York. There was almost no marbling or fat to the steak I had and it was tough to cut which suggested New York to me. Waiter insisted the steak was a rib eye just no fat. Either way I was completely unimpressed with the steak. I gave them 2 stars only because the service was ok and the drinks were good. For a $58 "prime" steak I expected a lot more than what was given to me
author: Corey S.

description: Excellent meat prepared well. Good apps and side choices. Glazed carrot delish. Service was good except for forgetting a side order. But we were stuffed plenty
author: Simon S.

description:
Very attentive host 
Server and staff- are awesome and tend to your every need 
Ambiance was mellow not too many people yet not so empty 
Style all over! The place is a well decorated, Leather and dark woods all around - polished silver and dark burgundy colors all around - 
My server suggested the Brownie Sunday and I loved it - I ate enough for two people but don't regret it - 
I will definitely be back for some more steak and to explore more of the menu !
author: Hector G.

description:
An elegant venue with fine ambiance to celebrate our 28 years of wedded bliss. The table is served with an appetizing jar of pickles - cucumber and red bell pepper to perk up your appetite.A delish light crusty bread as a side with butter (bread is from a wholesale bakery called Sweet Production from San Carlos) Best prime rib and rack of lamb (ask a side of mint jelly if preferred). Yummy sides of garlic mashed potato that you can customize by adding bacon, green onions or extra dollop of sour cream. The huge glazed carrot compliments the meal.
Service is attentive, friendly and non intrusive.
author: Carolina H.

description:
The overall experience was excellent. 

A very nice quite white table cloth restaurant. 

Our server had a great personality and took care of us well. 

They have a very good wine by the glass list.

The spinach salad was very tasty with
Lots of egg and bacon pieces. 

The star of the show was a 9 pounce prime fillet mignon. This was one of the best steaks I have ever eaten. Cooked perfectly. It ate like butter. Served with garlic mashed potatoes and a jumbo honey glazed carrot. 

The portions on salad and entree were large enough for me to share with my wife and walk away full. 

I would return to see Bob again if I were in the mood for a steak in San Francisco.
author: Bill H.

description: The meat taste rather cheap, it was not a good cut of meet. The sides was rather boring and worthless.
author: Dilan P.

description: Great traditional style steakhouse.  We had the bone-in ribeye cooked to perfection.  They could use a better selection of sides that come with the order, but the giant glazed carrot and huge baked potato were very good.
author: Paul M.

description:
Great service
Prime rib was excellent! I don't eat much red meat, and this dish was superb!
The large carrot that comes as the side of the meat entrees, is sweet & weird. Not a fan. 
Brownie dessert is delicious!
Will be back!
author: Tina H.

description: 4th and Long...TOUCHDOWN! To be fair my colleague's steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare. But I had to send my ribeye back twice. First time it was overdone. But never the less they finally nailed it and I was blown away. The house cab was phenomenal as well. Would come back here.
author: Alex C.

description:
Well this is the only Bob's that I know of that serves Breakfast!  Being that we have one of these fanciful lil steakhouses on every corner in Texas I was thrilled to dine here.  Coffee was perfect

Service was outstanding, Would love to come back and try the steak....Seems like our Texas locations can't cut it lately hense my low star rants and raves.  Ya know one thing about Bob...yeah he might of had some problems in life but at least he could run the business right.  Never had a bad meal when Bob was around

Sit by the window nice people watching I mean who can't get enough of black and blue suits with well groomed hair and polished shoes....gotta love that financial district.
author: Mary S.

description:
I had not been back to Bob's in a few years....but had always had great food and great service. 

Went with  a party for 13 loud boisterous attorneys, brokers and various miscreants.....and ya know what....the place was AWESOME.

I  had read a few of the latest yelp reviews and was somewhat skeptical ...I mean yelpers can be tough on places.

Our server was great: He was patient, fast, thorough, and efficient...he got everything right and served everything when it should be served.

We brought our on wine..but they served us and the wine service was great. Their legendary sour dough bread was warm and tasty served with great butter. I started off with the Blue Cheese Salad...which was a very nice sized salad with homemade blue cheese dressing, bacon, tomatoes and a mix of lettuces....really flavorful...and so large I shared with one of the others.

For my main course I had the 8oz strip steak with fries and their glazed carrots...everything was very good. The meat was cooked the way I like it: Medium Rare. Great fries..not too small (I hate shoestrings) and not too large(slabs of potatoe)...with the skins on...yum. Carrots are really good...tender bathed in a cinnamon sauce...perfect for the christmas season.

My only complaint was that it was a tad bit salty for my tastes...I would ask them next time to tone down the salt.
$55 bucks was my share...so for a salad, steak with sides, two glasses of win (only the corkage fee)...not cheap but not crazy expensive.

Great ambiance and service CHECK IT OUT.
author: David G.

description:
This was somewhat disappointing. Came here for a business luncheon with 5 other people, so we went straight for the main course. 

I got the filet mignon but asked the server if I could swap out carrots (I hate carrots) for something else, and she said "they're only a garnish but you can pay for another side." I declined. The carrots were big slabs taking over a third of the plate with a cinnamon sugar glaze which was disgustingly sweet. I was lucky as my filet was perfectly medium rare, but other people in my party got rare instead of medium rare and well done instead of medium so pretty inconsistent. My friend asked for the house potatoes but got smashed potatoes. I actually liked them - lots of butter and cream - I'm sure my waistline didn't!

The environment is nice, though, quiet enough for people to talk. The service was...okay...not just because of the Carrot Incident, but the wrong wine and the wrong potatoes. Not worth the money when there are so many other great steak houses in SF.
author: Mi M.

description: I will start by saying the service is five stars. Our waiter was very good and it helped that the restaurant was more or less half empty. Friday night busy weekend. Maybe that was the first clue!!  First the bread is no where near up to par with almost any San Francisco restaurant. Taste like they bought it from Safeway. Dry bland and needs much improvement. Then we split a wedge salad. Plenty big enough to split but they overloaded it with dressing and therefore was not wonderful. My husband said the rack of lamb was good and my rib eye was ok so hence three stars. The sides of mushrooms had no flavor at all but thanks that our waiter said to order half. Broccoli was very bland. Your dinner arrives with a huge steamed carrot that is seasoned but the seasoning includes cinnamon which I wasn't crazy about.  The fried potato mix was awful. Not sure if that's there special recipe but it has a gravy on it and just had no flavor at all. I think it's time for an overhaul of this restaurants menu. Sorry!  $200 down and only the company was pleasant!
author: S B.

description: Had the eggs benedict here which were pretty darn good. The price tab for said eggs benedict was a tad over $20 which prevents me from giving it 5 stars. The service was good and then even provided a complimentary smoothie which was cool. I could see myself coming back to try the steak which I think is more justifiable given the price tag.
author: Rod M.

description: We were staying at the Omni, so why not eat at the steak house that was street level? Our meal started off delayed as it took someone a few minutes to even greet us - we felt awkward just standing there for so long. The rest of the evening snowballed from there. I ordered a Manhattan that didn't come until after our first appetizer was served; and it was watery and made with maraschino cherries. Our entrees were good, but not great. The steak was so-so but the halibut was very good. All of the veggie sides were also done very well. Drink refills were a little hard to come by, but our server seemed to be missing most of the evening as well. Seems we must have come on a bad night for the staff. Definitely disappointing given the dozens of excellent choices in the area.
author: T P.

description: A little pricey but you really get that old school steakhouse experience with the ambiance. Menu has great options besides steaks and lots of sides to accompany the entree. Onion rings are on steroids if you get a plate of those. Each steak comes with a giant carrot like you are bugs bunny. Steaks are seared well to acccentuate the beef flavor. Awesome service too to round it all off.
author: Ed L.

description: Ambiance can be a bit quiet but the food, steaks especially, are perfect.  They source dry aged beef, which is always the best way to prepare beef for grilling.  I usually have the NY Strip, and they have many great sides to choose from.  Great location for a convenient business or post work date.
author: Jai V.

description:
The BF took me here for our anniversary dinner on a Saturday night. It was recommended to us by a random guy we met on the plane and he raved about this place. Surprisingly, it was very empty. Our server, Shelley, provided fantastic service.

We started with the calamari. It wasn't too good in our opinion.. The bread and butter that was provided to us was the best we've had anywhere. We also went with a bottle of the Davis family vineyard's Pinot noir. Delish!! 

The BF ordered the 12 oz filet mignon with baked potato and a side of creamed corn. I had the pork "ribs" chop with the side of smashed potatoes. The creamed corn and smashed potato was yummy. We were really full by the time we got to our entrees.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
Expensive steak in the fidi -- it was pretty okay steak, but not for the price. 
 
4 of us split the salmon salad to share so we could all get some veggies. Unfortunately, a salad split 4 ways meant we each got 5 leaves. Fiber-intake fail! 

The lunch came out to $212 before tip for 4 steaks and a salad. For that price, I've definitely had better steak in the city.
author: Annie Z.

description: This is the best steak I have ever had at a steak house. I am from Texas and tops all. The service is excellent and the drinks are amazing. This is our favorite steak house in SF!!!
author: Steve S.

description: From the outside this looks like a well heeled establishment.  And in fact the staff are courteous,  friendly and we'll trained.  The skills stop there.  I had the wedge salad to start and as simple as this dish is,  people still mess it up.  The iceberg lettuce was hard and difficult to cut (and eat). The blue cheese was of a variety that lacked bite (or taste). Following this I had the petite mignon. The meat was a good cut (albeit a bit undercooked) but it was hard to notice as it was swimming in butter.  Too much butter. I won't even go into the pan fried potatoes or the candied carrot. Who candies a carrot? Poor carrot. The final crime was the cheque which exceeded all logic. All in all a real disappointment. Avoid.
author: Chris H.

description:
I wanted to like this place because I like places like this.

I asked questions about ingredients on the menu and how things are cooked.  The waitress immediately identified me as trouble and it just went downhill from there.  

The waitress kept answering "Nope" or "Yep" when I asked specific questions and she refused to verify things will the kitchen -- saying they were too busy (even though the restaurant was only 1/2 full.) 

She was wrong.  I got sick and eventhough I complained and they removed the food, I still paid for the meal--or I should point out my colleague did.

I've always steered clear of restaurants inside of hotels because they are much more focused on volume than personal service.  This is no exception and a bad choice on my part.

Bummer.
author: Brian W.

description:
We come here pretty regularly!! I think the service is superb! Always very friendly when we come here!!!!! 
One time my bfs steak was cooked wrong n the manager was super apologetic about it n was very nice. But they always get the steak just right. I think him just coming over n being attentive made up for it. I thought so 
Its usually our go to steak place, always a safe bet!
author: Anudari K.

description:
A good US prime Steakhouse located in the downtown area at the Omni Hotel.

Service was very attentive, price is in line with other US Prime steak houses, I was present for a late lunch, but ordered the New York strip with potatoes and carrots along with soup. Glazed Carrots was a surprise.

The restaurant is split up into two sections, a dining area and a spot around the bar. There is plenty of other options in case you don't wish to order a $40 steak dinner, the lunch menu has several salad and sandwich options as well.
author: Kurt W.

description: Service was really good, and the food was delicious! It was a bonus for since we were staying in the hotel. We didn't have to go far for some good food and strong drinks! The "dirty Bob"and "Texas Pecan Pie" are a must try! We will be back!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
ABSOLUTELY THE BEST steakhouse I've been to, bar none (including Ruth's Chris).  My boyfriend and I both had the 12 oz. filet, and it was cooked to suit both of our needs (aka PERFECTION). 

They include sides of potatoes cooked to your liking as well as the most delicious glazed carrot to remind one of Thanksgiving dinner. We also shared a 2009 Merlot that went well with the veggies and bread that was served as a precursor to dinner. 

Great service, and excellent food.
author: Fawn M.

description:
It was last minute but I was able to get a cocktail in the bar.  And then get a table for dinner

The ny sirloin was cooked perfectly and had a great spice flavor to it.  

High end steak house that delivers on the atmosphere, great food and Excellent service.
author: John R.

description:
It's still our favorite Steak & Chop House to frequent before and after Christmas.  Their service is more attentive after our last visit.  We used to have a gigantic steak dinner here on special occasions and head over to the Carnelian Room for after-dinner drinks and the view.  Sad to see the Carnelian Room close...times sure have changed.  Although, it's not the original Bob's, I have been in love with SF Bob's since I was young, it's in the heart of Financial District when times were good back in the 80's.  I come here to reminisce about the good 'ole days.  It also makes it convenient for their Omni Hotel guests to come down and unwind.  Their steaks are flavorful and cooked to perfection!  They make the best cosmos, in addition to a wide selection of wines.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bobs-steak-and-chop-house-san-francisco?select=mOoiP2W_fg2C2B2zNUSg8w
author: Christine R.

description: Our experience at Bob's was fantastic.  The restaraunt if beautiful.  The service was impeccable.  Our food (steaks and lobster) was prepared perfectly as ordered.  What a fantastic experience.
author: Mark H.

description: Average overpriced steaks. Salads and sides bland and uninspirational. Skip it. So many better places in SF.
author: Jon D.

description: It has been a long time since my last visit to Bob's. It has once again impressed me with excellent service and delish tasting food. Lobster filled mash potatoes were a hit. And a glass of waiter recommended red blend was a perfect addition to the final dessert touch of amaretto marble cheesecake  ...
author: Vika S.

description:
I've been here a couple of times for both breakfast and dinner.

The food is always good, however the service is just inconsistent.  Some times it is spot on, yet other times you are left hanging around without any sign of service for 15mins at a time.
author: Chris I.

description:
Amazingly mediocre!  Don't waste your time or money here.  While the steak was a good cut and cooked reasonably well,  the rest of the meal was worthy of a great buffet.  One of our meals was overcooked while the carrot "feature" on every plate is comical.

The beefsteak tomato was wrong in so many ways it's not a worth describing.

It's a shame we took so many fine personal endorsements in trust.  In a major league city you can't play sand lot ball, and then charge major league prices.  

Strike, you're out!
author: Stephen P.

description:
its been almost 4 years since i have been to this steak house

im still thinking about  the ribeye steak i had there 

topnotch service and a wonderful hotel "the Omni"
author: Carmine C.

description: I've eaten at Bob's at least a half dozen times and had always thought it a bit expensive, but of high quality for good steaks.  Tonight's experience has definitely changed my opinion.  Various parts of the meal were inedible, including the bread that had been left in the warmer so long that it tasted like like cardboard, ditto for my potatoes.  Not sure why we even ordered desert, but they were equally bad and we left almost all of it behind.  I doubt any of this would have led me to write a review.  What really astonished me was the poor service relative to the number of staff in a half empty dining room.  It took a long time to order a glass of wine and nobody seemed at all curious about all the uneaten food.  At $300 for 3 people, I think you can do a lot better.
author: Kevin F.

description:
I was surprised to see that this was only rated 3 stars.  I loved the ambiance of the place, the warm classic decor and dim light  made the place feel comfortable.  Started with the fried calamari, a heaping portion of golden fried rings and tentacles that have a distinct crunch. A squeeze of lemon helps to cut the syrupy edge of the chile sauce that accompanies it.

Tried the 28 oz. Porterhouse, it was huge, my two guy friends were sharing it but couldn't even finish it so I had some as well.  The steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly. Easy to cut and easy to chew.  Tender and flavorful. Also had the rack of lamb, it was juicy and succulent.  I love lamb with mint jelly so I asked for some, gave the lamb more flavor and kick. Delicious! 

Bob's signature accompaniment is a whole carrot that comes on every plate, a little bit too sweet for my taste it actually tastes like sweet potato rather than a carrot. I chose the skillet fried potatoes rather than mashed potatoes and boy were they good.  Perfect compliment to the meats!  A bit on the pricey side but when you want good steak and chops I would reccommend this!
author: Maria M.

description: The definition of 5 star dining. Super expensive, but totally worth it if you're looking for a top end dining experience.
author: Tim B.

description:
Could not be happier with the food and service! I had requested a quieter area of the restaurant for myself and my aging father and they completely accommodated this request. In addition, lunch was delicious and a more than fair price for a petite filet which also came with soup, salad, and dessert. At the end of the lunch they brought out a beautiful dessert for his birthday as well.

Thanks for keeping it classy for my Dad's birthday.
author: Kendra S.

description:
I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and we loved it! we had read about it in an in-flight magazine last summer, and he hadn't stopped talking about it ever since, so I made us reservations for a Saturday night dinner.  the entire meal, including crab cakes, salad, sourdough bread, rib-eyes and dessert were amazing! our server and his helper were very nice, always refilled out glasses when they were empty, gave us time in between food sessions to enjoy and not rush us with the entree orders. they made conversation with us throughout the meal and were very polite and professional. The hostess was a bit... lets just say it took him a couple of times, spelling N-I-C-O-L-E, before he found our reservations, after telling me that we didn't have reservations.... I had the confirmation e-mail! 

Thanks Bobs! we will be back!!!
author: Nicolette C.

description:
As a hotel guest on a business trip, I always dread breakfast at the hotel restaurant. It usually means weak coffee, lackluster service and ho-hum food. 

Not so at Bob's! 

I needed a quick breakfast two days in a row and the coffee is strong (tasty) and breakfast delicious. The servers are fast and friendly. I caught up on work, enjoyed a satisfying meal and was ready to face the day ahead of me.
author: Shu Jin S.

description:
We arrived early at about 5:15 p.m. for our 5:30 p.m. reservations.  But, in our defense, we had a guest who was on East Coast time, so for him it was 8:15 p.m.  No one was at the host podium.  After we hovered around the podium for a bit, a waiter (fortunately, not the one who waited on us) came up to the podium.  Before I could even tell him that we were early for a 5:30 p.m. reservation, he spit out, "Not open until 5:30!"  I explained, "We're early for a 5:30 reservation."  He snarled "We aren't open until 5:30!"  In response, I said  "Oh okay, I guess we'll wait at the bar across the way?"  He then just walked away.  

I found his demeanor and attitude rude and offensive.  He could have politely suggested that we wait in the lobby or grab a drink at the bar across the hallway until they opened at 5:30 p.m.

Fortunately, after grabbing a cocktail across the hallway (which was seamlessly transferred to our dinner bill), and checking in with who I assume is the regular hostess, we were promptly seated and waited on by a much more pleasant waiter and busboy.

Our party of three shared an order of fried calamari and shrimp platter.  The fried calamari was battered and fried to perfection.  The shrimp was fresh and flavorful.  Both appetizers were served with a delightful cocktail sauce and half a juicy lemon.  I liked the cocktail sauce very much because it was not overly horseradishy, just the right amount to give it a subtle kick.

I don't know where it went wrong.  Maybe instead of the plain old ribeye steak, I should have ordered the bone in ribeye, but frankly, that's just too much meat for lil' old me.  Maybe my expectations were too high, but the Prime ribeye steak from Costco I cooked last week with some Montreal Steak Seasoning and Cajun spice last week tasted better that the ribeye steak from Bob's.  Bob's ribeye steak had good seasoning, but it was more of a medium than the medium rare I ordered.  I think that might've been what ruined it for me.  Whatever the reason, the ribeye was disappointing  For me, it was a mediocre steak not worth the $40 plus dollar price tag.
author: Christina L.

description:
I came here last night to celebrate my boyfriend's 25th birthday.
