description: Recently stayed at The Omni Hotel over the weekend to celebrate me and my boyfriends birthday. He made reservations at the restaurant which is connected to the hotel. The service was fantastic and the food was Delicious! I would visit and dine there again :)
author: Yelper S.

description:
CREAMIEST MASH POTATOES EVER!!!!
(4.25 stars)

They could literally rename the restaurant "Bob's Mash Potatoes and Steak House". Have you ever wanted to do some kind of odd activity with your food besides eat it? After the first few bites of my mash potatoes... felt like Iwanting to go skinny dipping with my mash potatoes. They were SO delicious and smooth and creamy LIKE BUTTER, I just wanted to jump in them and swim. Forget the steak, hand me a plate of mash potatoes!!

- Food, delicious
- Prices, expensive 
- Service, pretty good
- Ambiance, business

Always wanted to eat here and walked by this restaurant for the past 6yrs working in the area. My bigboss and some new teammates flew in from NY office. We had a team dinner and was treated to this place. Felt very underdressed because everybody was in business attire at this restaurant (hence, it is in the FiDi). But never once, felt uncomfortable. Gosh i hope he expensed the bill because it sure aint cheap eating here.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

PRIME FILET MIGNON (~$45) - Ordered the 9oz because I am a small ass person. I usually order it Medium-well but decided to try Medium and had it with a salad. They say the raw(er) the better. Complimentary bread was average. The salad was average. When our plates arrived to the table, the plate presentation was really plain. Steak, a carrot, and mash potatoes. First few bites into the steak made me think I ordered the steak medium-well because I was not really seeing pink. But then afterwards, i saw the pink. My steak was very tasty and delicious. I've been to several steak houses and Bob's is not my #1 but it's still very good and I do like it and will recommend it. The carrot in the middle of the plate was pretty good. It had this sweet taste to that really balanced the saltiness of the steak. AND THE MASH POTATOES... geez, i can go on and on forever about this. In fact, can i just have a plate of mash potatoes because they were THAT good. They were SO creamy, soft, and melt like butter. Having a FOODGASM moment just thinking about it.

Will I be back? If i am lucky to have another buisness dinner here.

JABA APPROVED.. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
This was not my first time, dining at this amazing calibur restaurant. Bob's Steak & Chop House, offers one of the best Steaks I have ever eatin. The Rib-eye 12oz is such an amzing cut of meat, never in my life before have I had a Rib-eye melt in my mouth. Every bite explodes with tender juicy flavor. I also recomend that you try the fired Calamari to start, or the Bleu Cheese  Wedge Salad, with Bob's very own homemade amazing bleu cheese dressing; but make sure that you have at least two other people with you, as the portions are quite large. 

The food is not only the really great part of my experiance everytime I go to Bob's. The service is always top notch and extremely professional. 

Each aspect of the dining experiance is always absolutley perfect. Thank you to all the staff and also a special thanks to Managers Matt and Server Shelly for your great service and making sure that my experiance was just as perfect as the last.
author: Jason F.

description: I must say if you like steak (filet or bone in ribeye) , veal, pork chops, or lamb, you have to try one of them. I came with a group of six and we each tried one of the above. The food was excellent.   Calamari was good as we'll.  I recommend this place to anyone loving to eat meat.
author: Will E.

description:
A-OK Lunch here. The steak sandwich was pretty good, but the cup of chicken noodle to start was bizarre.... not a fan.

Carrot cake was fine, but a little too dense for my liking. Fairly pricey, but if you like the old-school traditional steakhouse feel, this would be a great spot for you.
author: K. D.

description: We went here to celebrate our engagement and a birthday with my parents. Everything from the food to the service was excellent. I would definitely go back for a fancy dinner!
author: Melissa B.

description: Had a few meals here while staying at the hotel for business.  Thought that it was a little too expensive and the customer service could have been better.
author: Jen H.

description:
The filet was good, but the prime rib was a quarter inch thick. The pork chops were nasty, and our table all had had better mashed potatoes elsewhere. The carrot they give you is full of cinnamon and no one ate ours and we all love carrots. Would not recommend to anyone given that we live in San Francisco...

The bread was the only decent thing they offered.
author: Patrick M.

description: They took our party of 5 without a reservation, service is first class & the food was fantastic. I thought it would be very expensive for being located in the Omni hotel however it was very reasonable. The wine pours are very generous
author: Stan L.

description: We stopped here on a whim for a drink and a football game.  Ended up ordering dinner right at the bar.... Spinach salad was great. Drinks are generous, I had the filet which was cooked perfectly.  Staff was very polite and generous.  Excellent chop house at a reasonable price
author: Chris H.

description:
AMAZING! From the service to the steak and out the door with the homemade desert. When ever I visit San Fran I will make a point to come here, especially for the Kansas City strip! Medium well was done perfectly, melted like butter in my mouth and had the perfect thin charred crispness on the outside. 
Environment was traditional, cozy, upscale ambiance. The wait staff was wonderful, prompt, attentive, got everything right! Timed the app to the salad to the entrée perfectly! A bit on the high end for price but I expected that for this location in the heart of financial district. The quality was there, key lime pie, no words- more please! so good, but actually- share it- so rich.
author: Uptowngirl 3.

description: Good onion rings, desert, potatoes, shrimp cocktail, but bad steak. $48 for a 16oz ribeye that looked and tasted like a $9.99 sirloin from Safeway. Sorry to say it, but don't bother.
author: Larry R.

description:
Bob's is an upscale steak house located in the same building as Omni Hotel. I love the ambiance because it is quite and slow in pace. I like the semi dim lighting and the decor of the restaurant. The decor of the restaurant feels welcoming and warm. It is one of those restaurant where you can enjoy your meal in peace without feeling rushed by the waitor to leave after you have finished your plate. It is a nice place for a romantic dinner for two or a great place to enjoy a meal beforehand with good friends before a night out on the town. Moreover, there is a bar across the aisle that also belongs to Bob's. The bar is also really nice and classy. It is a spot that you can enjoy a drink or two without the loud music or television and loud patrons in the background. The patrons at Bob's are "mature" and thus, are not like the loud patrons at some of the places that I've found myself at. They also have finger food at the bar.

Skimming through the menu, I contemplated between the filet mignon or the crab cakes. I decided on the filet mignon because my friend wanted the crab cakes and I can sample off of her plate. The filet mignon was ok. I've never had such a big glazed carrot served to me before. It was huge! I wasn't too satisfied with the crab cakes only because I've had better. 

Overall, the setting of this place is nice and service is attentive but the food is mediocre.
author: Linh N.

description:
Took a few interview candidates here for lunch and I was not as impressed as I had hoped to be.

I ordered the steak sandwich since it was lunch i figured that was a bit more appropriate then a big steak.  It tasted pretty good, but the steak they used was a little to tough for a sandwich.  I got the fries with it which were decent, but I don't really bring that into my rating too much.  The service was great, but the sandwich was just not up to a four star standard... Sorry Bob keep trying!
author: Johnny A.

description: Mostly financial district lunch/work environment.  Everyone had ice tea with their Prime rib... Attentive yet pricey due to locations...  Decent place.
author: Betty L.

description: Bob's was an okay steakhouse, but nothing spectacular, especially considering the prices.  The vibe is very old school, but we had dinner on a slow night and it was really empty.  Salads were huge, but not particularly flavorful.  The steak itself was also fine, but not the same quality of meat as Ruth's Chris or Harris.  Overall, it was fine, but I expected more.
author: Michelle C.

description:
The food was decent, pretty standard fare for a steakhouse and worth 3-4 stars. We ate at the bar, standard ambiance with football games on.

The reason that Bob's is getting one star is because my and my boss's medium-rare ribeye steaks came out pretty much well done, and when we mentioned they were "slightly" overcooked when asked, our waiter proceeded to tell us it was the light setup that made the steaks look darker and that they were actually medium-rare. Not sure how light can uncook/rarify steaks but if somebody knows, please update me. All I know is my tastebuds can taste how cooked a steak is and my knife can feel how tender a steak is.

Glazed carrot and potatoes were pretty good. In terms of wine selection ,I'm not really a wine drinker but my boss was disappointed in the selection as well.
author: Steven T.

description: Back in town so I had to re-try Bob's and I have to say it was better than the last time. Price point is till on the high side but the food and service provided was amazing.
author: Kelvin B.

description:
Had little over an hour to check in at the Omni and walk back to the office to finish up a presentation. Hadn't eaten anything all day so decided to check out Bob's since it is located in the hotel. 

The dining room has an elegant, yet relaxed atmosphere and the staff was super nice and helpful. 

Ordered a glass of Pinot Noir and Fish & Chips off the lunch menu. Knowing that I was going out to dinner later, I told myself that I would not eat the whole lunch. Wishful thinking! When the food arrived, I took one bite and was hooked. I wolfed down the entire meal!!! 

Went back to work full, happy, and content. 

Definitely would recommend Bob's.
author: Miko C.

description:
This is a review of the bar only.  You should be warned, everyone there is either a high-roller or a tourist with deep pockets -- this is the bar in the Mandarin Oriental in the middle of the financial district -- so cocktails are $15 for a reason, but beers on tap (which aren't listed on the menu) are only $6.  Therefore, you must be a regular to know how to order a beer, capice? 

I had the ginger beer which is bud/miller/coors (something like that) with ginger liquer.  It's surprisingly good, but is it worth $10 + tax + tip?  Nuts served in the bar are surprisingly like the Wasabi Wow mix from Trader Joe's -- cranberries, wasabi peas, peanuts, cashews, and almonds.  (Add golden raisins and you get Wasabi Wow!)

The chairs are comfy, if you can get one -- it gets a bit crowded right after work...
author: Olivia L.

description:
Been here a few times. Both of my experiences were spectacular.

Best ambiance of any steakhouse in the Bay Area I've visited.  And, I think the Kansas City strip is the best in the Bay, hands down.

if you like steakhouses, and want a nice date night hotel in the city, the Omni is gorgeous, and they have great weekend rates because it's located in the financial district.  

Highly recommend Bob's!
author: Danny L.

description:
Picture this.  No patrons is in the "high end" restaurant.  You arrive, excited about your dinner plans, and no one greets you.  Believe it or not, it actually goes down hill from here:

- An extremely cramped seat in a totally open restaurant
- Totally flavorless bread served steaming hot, (giving the appearance
   that it is fresh - until 5 minuets later when it became hard like a rock.
- An unprepared table (salt, pepper, etc missing)
- A huge jar of pickles on the table.  I talk to the waiter about them, and he
  tells me where they buy them from and that they stuff them into the jar for
  guests).
- A carrot, that was as phallic as Jeff Stryker (I think they are proud of this)
- A Brownie dessert; expensive and common
- Waiter unengaugjng.
author: Mark F.

description: Profoundly disappointing experience. Pedestrian menu, blah food, pitiful customer service with our bill, which was mixed up and took us forever to figure out.
author: Laura G.

description:
The food was excellent. My buddy had a great looking steak sammy. I had the scallops which were excellent. One thing....at $20 a glass, can't you break out the good stemware? The pour was fine but the glasses were incorrect for my Pinot and my buddy's Cabernet. 

Bob. Dude. It's the details. Know them. Love them.
author: Brian B.

description:
Went here for New Years 2010 having made reservations ahead of time were the first to be seated.  Apparently there was a mistake that night, the chef had accidently cut the steak into 28oz sections instead of 16oz.  I was made aware of this ahead of time after placing my order and was not charged extra.  Thankfully, walking back to our parking space worked off some of the food :)

The food and service were outstanding, definitely one of the best experiences my wife and I ever had.  The only downside I have to write about is the "Maryland Style Crab Cake" is not Maryland style and had been pan fried instead of baked as my wife likes her Crab cakes. (From then on we've learned to ask before ordering how they are cooked).
author: Jarred C.

description: The lunch I had at this restaurant gave me food poisoning! This was the only meal I ate, no breakfast or snacks, so I know for a fact it was this meal that made me violently ill. I had the Cobb salad with grilled chicken and blue cheese dressing on the side, while my guest had Cobb salad with crab and vinaigrette dressing on the side. She did not get ill. So, I would guess either the blue cheese dressing or the chicken was bad. By 5PM I was starting to feel very hot, with cold chills racing thru my body. When I left work at 5:30pm, the nausea had kicked in, the chills got worse. I got home by 6PM and violently threw up the entire meal (and the rest of my guts). This is the worst experience I have ever had and will never eat at this restaurant again and would not want anyone else to have such a horrible experience from this restaurant either. So BEWARE! I will be filing a complaint with the health department.
author: Joyce W.

description: My filet mignon was comes perfectly cooked and the mashed potatoes were so tasty.  Server was very friendly.   I think it was a little overpriced though.
author: Jessica W.

description: Very underwhelmed! We had the halibut fish special... Terrible! Over cooked.... it was set on top of a rice mixture a 5 year old could have prepared! The Kansas City strip was over cooked and had no flavor. Very disappointed we wasted one of our nights out in the city here. Do yourself a favor and read the reviews... We made the mistake of just eating here because it was in our hotel and appeared to be a nice steak house in a very elegant hotel!
author: Holly P.

description:
In a nut shell - overpriced, mediocre steak, stale bread, nothing special.

The bread was icky, stale and warmed up in the oven. Believe me, I've tried to resurrect stale bread, and it had that familiar taste of failure. Complimentary pickles are offered at the center of every table (it looks just as weird as it sounds). I started with the cocktail shrimp, 4 for $16 - decent but not worth the price. The high note of my meal was the beefsteak tomato onion salad. Next, I got the 22 oz bone in rib eye, it was nice that the entrees included sides, but they were very ordinary just like the steak. I especially wasn't a big fan of the carrot (yes, ONE carrot), which tasted like it was cooked in apple cider. And what's up with the creme brulee? I honestly thought creme brulee was impossible to ruin, but this was probably the worst creme brulee I've ever had.

If i wanted quantity, I would've just gone to Black Angus and saved some $$$. Portions were generous, but who cares when the food isn't good? This was definitely not worth the 1000 opentable points, but if you feel the need to try Bob's, I'd recommend coming on Sunday because at least parking is a breeze.

1.5 because of the tomato onion salad and a nice waitress

==============================================
UPDATE: OMG, I didn't get my 1000 points because I was 15 minutes late. GRR!! 0 stars!! I hate you Bob!
author: Jess C.

description: I drove in from Los Angeles to meet my brother for a late night dinner. I read your great things about this restaurant however I didn't really see them. Personally I thought the service was awful our waiter was somewhere arrogant. The steaks were okay overpriced but OK because of the service I'll give this place a two star rating.
author: Sergio C.

description:
I don't eat steak, but no matter. We had brunch here a couple of Sunday mornings ago for a dear friend's birthday, and the meal was outstanding! The eggs were hot, the omelette was cooked perfectly, even the coffee was excellent (and we're coffee snobs). Moreover, the service added more to the meal than all the other delectibles. Our waiter, Mark, was efficient and friendly, and he was an utter joy to spend a morning and, uh,  afternoon with. We stayed late - I think an hour after closing - and he was as gracious as he could be! 

We sat in a private booth, which was elegant and fun and made us feel like royalty.

If you're in SF looking for an elegant place for breakfast, don't miss Bob's.
author: Lori H.

description: We stayed at the Omni, where this restaurant is, and when the rain started coming down really hard, we gave up and ate here. The steaks were quite good, and perfectly prepared to order. My salad was also very good, and our service was superb. The wine was offered by both major brands, and small Napa and Sonoma wineries that were nearby. But the price was what blew my mind. All weekend, we were paying top dollar for some really nice places. The prices were pretty darn good in comparison to equally fancy places.
author: Gigi K.

description: Just ate here with a group of friends who are pretty loud and the staff was great with us. The service and ambience is awesome.  The wedge salad and mashed potatoes were amazing.  My steak was medium rare instead of medium and I really could have used some sauce for flavor but they were no offerings.  The onion ring appetizer was disappointing, it was just giant frozen rings that came to the table lukewarm.  Overall not bad but you could probably find a better steak house in the city.
author: Eliza M.

description: Steaks are good! The service was also good but slow. It took close to half an hour before we got our salad. We came here on a Saturday night close to 8:30. The place had a decent sized crowd but not packed so I guess they were understaffed?? which could explain the food coming out slow. The wait staff tried making it up by being polite. However, the thing I don't understand is why they would pour gravy over fried skillet potatoes that made it lose its crispness!  The potatoes were swimming in the gravy so they were just soggy potatoes.
author: Nancy F.

description:
Several of my friends and I went to Bob's Steak and Chop House to celebrate a birthday.

The food here is so so.  The drinks are great.  If it weren't the bad customer service I got from the guy  at the front desk, I might give this place a four stars.  

I agree with most of the reviewers here about how great the food tastes, I guess it becuase they add butter to every thing.  I didn't find the carrot as good as I thought it would be after reading a lot of good things about it on Yelp.  I guess my high expectation got shot down.
author: Truong P.

description:
The cote de boeuf (bone-in ribeye) was a perfectly cooked medium rare, however it was quite undersalted so the flavors didn't achieve their potential. The carrot that accompanied the dish was good, but a bit to sweet. The baked potato was excellent. And alas, the creamed corn and creamed spinach were forgettable. 

Bob's is an interesting place. As part of the Omni Hotel, it's small, tries to be classy (you get the well dressed sitting next to tourists in t-shirts), and would succeed better if it didn't put its diners on display with the huge windows that face Montgomery St. 

Save for a few details which I've listed, the food was good, the portions were generous to the point of being excessive, but for a true San Francisco steakhouse experience, I'd go elsewhere.
author: Cristofer P.

description: Bob's has been on my list of local steak houses to check out for quite some time. Am I glad we made it last night to Bob's the service food and drinks were top notch. I had the rib eye steak this is the signature steak at Bob's and it was one of the best ever. So flavorful and cooked perfectly as I had requested. Very nice dining room and location. We will be back!
author: Joe M.

description:
I can't believe I almost forgot to write a review for this place. Anyways, after a disappointing dinner at Alfred's (see my previous review) for New Years, I still had a hunkering for a great steak and Alfred's steakhouse just didn't cut it for me. And since my girlfriend knows I love steak and my birthday was coming up, she treated me here.

First off, this place is located in the Omni hotel. The vibe still felt sophisticated to say the least. Our server was very polite and professional. The warm bread for starters was excelled. It was warm, fluffy and just plain good.

I opted for the NY 12 oz with a side of grilled potatoes covered in gravy. My steak was seasoned and cooked to perfection. One thing I really liked about my steak was that my cut of meat literally had almost no fat whatsoever on it! It really makes me appreciate the chefs back there giving me a very good cut of meat but also a cut that is mostly edible. There was maybe one very small part of fat but that was it! 

My grilled potatoes with gravy were great as well. My girlfriend had the filet minon. She always gets filet so I asked her to compare it to other great steakhouses and she said it was high on her list. I had a small bite and it was very tender, juicy and cooked to perfection once again.

Overall, it's a great place. It's up there with the greats, at least to me (Alexander's and Harris).
author: James K.

description:
Stayed at the Omni for 4 days. Ate at Bob's on 3 separate occassions, all of which were great. Very flavourful ribeyes, tender filet, crisp vegetables, amazing salads, pleasant bread.

My first night arriving to the hotel, I stopped in for a ribeye dinner. I can easily do without the carrot. Strange sweet sauce. I would love the carrot without the same. Great texture and very sweet all on its own. 

Potatos on the side can be ordered baked or sauteed with some weird cream and onions. I'll take baked.

Salad was fresh and lightly dressed. Good flavour.

Filet was amazingly tender. Could almost cut it with a fork. Good seasoning, not overbearing. The meat had a good natural taste to it that is a distinct sort of calm gaminess with high grade beef. Very impressed. Not the best, but definitely one of the best. 

Garlic fries were amazing.

This may not be a place I'd endeavour to stop while in SF, but it's worth its placement in the Omni.
author: Yuki M.

description: You won't wait for a table and the food came out in under 10 minutes, but it was ok (at best) and expensive. For what you will spend you are better off going somewhere else.
author: Dennis O.

description:
I am not sure what was wrong but did not get the experience I expected.
Service was great and right on par.
Pickles and sourdough bread was wonderful.
Cesear salad was good but got dressing on the side and it was very watery. Coworker got the chowder and said it was the best he ever had.
Then the main course came. We both got steaks with the garlic mashed. I like my steak medium it was more on the side of medium well. It was good, but not what I expected from a fine restaurant. My coworker said his was perfect and it did look cooked perfectly medium. 
I didn't complain, which is my own fault, but expected better.
author: Scott B.

description:
I NEVER thought this day would come, NEVER!!
After having dinner here the other night, I said the words I never like to say when eating a piece of steak: "It's uneventful."

The steak I had was lacking flavor, the baked potato was dry and flaky, and I was left very unhappy.  I take meat very seriously, and this meat was not taken seriously.  I seriously have to drop my rating from 5 to 3 stars.  Sorry Bobby, but your cut didn't make the cut this time.
author: Karen B.

description:
I come here often when I do not want to be inundated with noise. It is expensive, but it has a bleu cheese stuffed olive martini, which starts a meal off well. 

I like the service, although I have been surprised how often I have been there and there are very young children in the main dining area. While I understand families have to eat, for $40-$60 for a steak, your parent's should be crying, and I certainly don't want to hear it.

Bread, fantastic. Steak, always done right.

P.S. There is something fundamentally wrong about 3 sliders for $18.
author: A I.

description: I came to the Omni Hotel for a two day conference and ordered room service from Bob's Steak and Chop House.  Granted I didn't have steak or meat, but my orders BOTH times were super salty.  I had the crab cake entree first night, and it was salty.  I had the scallops second night, and it was salty.  I do like the giant glazed carrot though.  Otherwise, everything else I had was salty.
author: Yun C.

description:
Solid financial district steak house, and a little pricer than some other locations in the city because of that.

I'd been telling Todd F about this place for months, about the nearly epic carrot that comes with every dish (mostly a novelty).  He was a little hesitant at first, because we, admittedly, didn't want to risk a bad steak experience at a new place when we have good options that we have experience with.

But Bob's does not disappoint.
author: Andy B.

description:
Bob, you did me right.

Andy B. and I had the 2011 MC1 Meat Club meeting at Bob's last night.    I had the 12oz filet which was huge (note to self, next time 9oz is fine) and delicious.    The steak arrived exactly as I ordered it (medium rare of course, is there any other way?), along with its sides of the glazed carrot and smashed potatoes.

The standard test that I use to judge a steakhouse is whether or not I can make the same meal at home, using my skill set and tools available, at the same level of quality that I am being served at.    In most instances I can, which in my book is a steakhouse fail.   The only other place I have been to in the city that I can say will surpass my own quality of meat preparation, besides Bob's now, is Harris.  

Bob, you're in rare company my friend.  Keep on steakin'.
author: Todd F.

description: I love me some Bobs. This is where you go for steak...forget Ruths Chris, Mortons...Bobs is all you need to know. Yeah, its expensive and worth every penny, something I cant say for 90% of dining experiences here in SF. Every meal Ive ever had here has been executed perfectly. Service is on point, the food...man the food! The carrots, something that is essentially garnish next to that beautiful hunk of filet mignon...even that carrot is stupid delicious. Anybody giving this place one star needs their head checked.
author: Michael G.

description:
I have had an office in the Financial District for 40 years and a patron of Bob's for at least a dozen of those. I eat lunch there regularly and along with the food being terrific, the staff are to a person friendly, helpful, attentive and competent, from the hostess to the busboys. I keep coming back because they make it so pleasant and the surroundings so comfortable. They treat everyone with graciousness and care. I notice that when it's busy, everyone will pitch in to help: the hostess may serve a meal, the busboys bring a drink or coffee, a waiter helps another waiter. Not only does that make things move smoothly and efficiently, they all work together to make sure it's a comfortable, professionally-run experience.
Dr. Michael Hack
author: Raymond H.

description: Solid, traditional steakhouse. Service is a little below the traditional excessive steakhouse model, but it's good.
author: Michael B.

description:
I have a friend that is embodiment and personification of Texas. When Bob's opened up in the Omni Hotel she had to take me here. It's apparently an establishment out of the Dallas/Fort Worth area (where she's from) and popular with the locals there.

I've yet to go to Texas and eat the legendary bbq and steaks there,  so I was looking forward to trying this place since it was a Dallas staple.  Being a huge NY steak fan I ordered the bone-in NY Strip which came perfectly cooked medium rare.  Bob's entrees come with these glazed carrots the size of your forearm (they are bigger in Texas) and a choice of potatoes. The one unique choice that you can get is the skillet fried potatoes topped with sauteed onions and peppercorn gravy. Delicious.

This place is definitely not a good place for a diet. The portions are huge( I had lunch the next day) and if you plan on finishing your meal you're not going to leave hungry. Because it's in a hotel, it's a bit pricey but no worse than any of the other good steak  houses in the city. You'll generally find mostly business travellers and special occasion diners here, but don't let that defer you from getting a really solid Texas steak dinner.
author: Kim N.

description:
As you can see by the pictures, their steaks come with a huge carrot. I'm not much of a carrot guy but that thing was frickin ridiculous!!! The steak was delicious and cooked perfectly, but something about the stupid carrot...i wanted a second order!! Anyways...i will be returning to Bob's for steak...and well, a carrot HAAHAA

I also had the rosemary potatoes, they were ok but the flavor was a little overpowering. I recommend the mash potatoes, they were much better tasting!!
author: Derek N.

description:
In short, good ambiance, good service, great steak but be prepare to pay a pretty penny for it. 

Info that you might find useful:
-Classy ambiance but unlike Harris you do not need to come dress up. There were definitely some people in jeans. 
-A big jar of pickles is on every table and you can have as many as you want on the house. The idea seems pretty cool but everyone in my party thought they were neither sour or salty enough.  
-Steaks are very tender. Prices vary from $35 for a 9 oz Filet Mignon to $70 for the Porterhouse.
author: Connie S.

description:
Best Steak I have ever had.

My Bosses took me here one night and both the service and food were amazing.  

Had the Shrimp Cocktail (huge),  Bone-In Steak with whole carmelized carrot and potato chips,  and ended with a large Brownie (best dessert ever).

The entire staff new my party by name and welcomed me as the newbie/virgin.  It was an excellent experience.
author: Cesar V.

description:
Went to Bob's the other day with two of my guy friends for a "man night."  I had promised to buy them a steak dinner for a long time, and we finally went to Bob's.  Even though it's in a hotel, the restaurant has a good steakhouse feel to it, which I always appreciate.

I started off with a martini, and it was pretty big, and quite strong.  Then we decided to share the fried calamari and crab cake for appetizers.  The calamari was pretty good, but the crab cake was amazing.  If it wasn't a steakhouse, I might have to go back one day and just have the crab cake dinner!  

Ribeye is my favorite cut, and the last couple of times I went out for steak, they didn't have ribeye -- e.g. Bobo's and other non-steakhosues -- so I was excited for Bob's.  I had heard a lot about the Cote de Beouf, but I wasn't hungry enough for it, so I just ordered the regular ribeye.  Good thing too, because I didn't realize how big the sides were!  The steak came with a glazed carrot and skillet-fried potatoes.  This was a JUMBO carrot, and it was delicious -- "best carrot ever" according to one of my friends -- and the potatoes were good too.  The steak was perfectly medium rare, and just lightly seasoned so the meat was accentuated and not overpowered by the seasoning.  The whole plate was great, and I had no room for dessert at the end.  

Overall, the meal was amazing, and I look forward to my next trip there.
author: Pilan C.

description:
I'm really late getting to this review because I was really depress at how the Lakers lost game1 to the Mavs then went on to get swept. Now I'm over and my new finals prediction is about to happen. Mavs/Heat with Mavs in 7!  Yeah I said Mavs in 7 

Ok Bob's bar is the business even when its busy. You can order just about any drink you want and they can make it for you and if you're like me once in a while you invent a drink and they can make that as well. 

The dining experience wasn't so great. Maybe it was because we at late or it was a busy Friday night. Our server was so so and very slow. The bread and water were great for the first 20 minutes. 

Once our steaks come out they seemed a little greasy okay very greasy! It was like the steaks were fried in oil or something. The over all taste was okay but I've had better steak and I don't even eat a lot of steak. The sides were just lame minus the mash potatoes. The cream of spinach was bland, the country potatoes and gravy was over cooked and maybe under seasoned and the baked potato was also small and over cooked. 

Would I eat here again? Maybe because maybe they were just having a bad night.
author: Karim R.

description:
Amazing melt in your mouth steaks and sides. You have to try the creamed corn, and the carrot that comes with most of the meals is delicious. 
Pricey, for sure, but well worth it. The waiters are great.
author: Kristy M.

description:
This is a quintessential hotel restaurant in the FiDi. The service is personal and adequate. The menu provides the "classic" american staples - steak and chicken sandwiches, a couple of salads, steaks. The wine list is not notable, but it is still adequate. The prices are high. 

The bar staff here, however, bumps this place up to three stars. Great banter & repoire with their regulars; stiff drinks; generous pours. All of this has turned overpriced, slightly-below-average food and options into wonderful visits on two occasions - both very extended lunches that went well into the afternoon. 

Come here with company, particularly company who knows the staff, and you'll be in for a good time. Otherwise...there are many better choices in the area.
author: Gregory S.

description:
IF I COULD GIVE THEM A NEGATIVE STAR, I WOULD. 

I purposefully made an account with Yelp just to rate this restaurant. My colleagues and I walked in and were asked if we wanted a private booth which we thought was cool and things were off to a good start.

That's where it ended. 

The quality of food was very POOR. We all ordered the Kansas Cut Steak and was brought the wrong order for one of the guys. The meal was over priced for what it is. I felt as if I was served from a buffet spread. The veggies were over cooked although the steak was decent. I had much higher expectations for a steak house like this.

The service was BEYOND DISAPPOINTING. The host had to bring us our food while the table still had dirty appetizer plates. The host insisted on handing one of the guys a scorching hot plate instead of placing it on the table. I had to clean up the table myself to give room for the dinner plates. Prior to that, I also had to get up to bus our old wine glasses because our table was getting cluttered. 

COMPARED TO BOBO'S OR HARRIS, THIS PLACE DOES NOT HOLD A LIGHT TO EITHER.  If I'm paying $50.00 for a steak, I expect a good steak and GOOD service. At one point during the dinner, I HAD to ask the waiter to pay more attention to our table and check in on us. He was dumbfounded and made an excuse that he had a table of four that turned into a party of 22. I understand that it was unexpected, but FIGURE IT OUT, tell your manager or ask for some help. 

I DON'T RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT TO ANYONE. My first dining experience at Bob's Steakhouse was just as bad, I'll NEVER DINE HERE AGAIN.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Overpriced without the coupon.  But we had wanted to try it and are glad we tried it, but won't be back. Service is very good.  But presentation?  That big carrot?  The steak was good and cooked right, but a lot of places can do that for less money!

And the room was cold!
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
old school steak house serving out huge slabs of meat....like my bedroom.  

in seriousness, this place is legit...  boner appetit!
author: Colin L.

description: Great food, awesome service, amazing drinks. Bobs is my second favorite steakhouse. I don't know what else to say other than five stars all the way!
author: Crimson Fiona M.

description:
This place is delicious. If you're eating on a budget, don't come here. Drinks are pricey and some of the better steak cuts can be pricey as well. But FOR WHAT IT IS, it's an amazing restaurant. The service is good, relatively quick, and you always leave STUFFED.

Expected bill for 1: $60.
author: Tushar K.

description: the food is really good。i had a 12oz prime ribeye. however， their service is just ok，and this is the only reason i take one star off。its good for dates， family， and business。
author: Momo W.

description:
YO ADRIAN GREAT Food & Bev 

Yes these are city prices, Bob's is in the Financial District. Food and service are strong points. Sit down dining is a bit formal which may be attractive to some and the bar and lounge is more casual. This restaurant has very little employee turnover which speaks volumes. Adrian is one such employee. She has worked the bar since opening. She is a true asset as are many of the other servers and bartenders. Shrimp Cocktail gives credence to the oxymoron of JUMBO SHRIMP like their carrot on steroids.
author: Stephen W.

description: Went there for my boyfriend's birthday with a few of our friends. Our server was ok, nothing spectacular, although it did took them almost half the meal time to get me a vodka tonic. The onion rings were HUGE, ribeye was good (not to the point of exceptional though), the side order of cream of spinach was too salty and over cook, but the side order of mushrooms were AWESOME.
author: Cindy L.

description:
My boyfriend and  I chose this place as really nice date night.  Unfortunately, I was not WOW'ed.  Since Bob's is in the financial district in addition to being in a high end hotel it is quite pricey.  I am always willing to pay extra for exceptional food but this was not quite worth it.

What we ordered:
1 beer, and 1 House Cabernet.
12oz Rib eye and the 12oz. New York Strip.
Sides: Skillet Fried potatoes with peppercorn gravy and mashed garlic potatoes.  Each dish also came with a gigantic carrot in the middle, warm bread, and a jar of home-made pickles on the table.

The bread was warm and delicious and our drinks came quickly!  Off to a good start...

My steak (the Rib-eye) was undercooked but still delicious!  I was impressed but the steak itself but the peppercorn potatoes left me a little disappointed.  I expected a strong delicious peppercorn taste but it really just tasted like plain thanksgiving gravy.  The carrot was also overcooked and I wish I could have subbed it for another veggie like broccoli or something.  

My boyfriend's steak (the New York Strip) was not impressive.  He felt like he could make this quality if a steak at home, and for these prices that is unacceptable.  He also thought the sides were mediocre and was generally unimpressed with Bob's.  

In a city full of expensive and AMAZING steakhouses like BoBo's and House of Prime Rib you need to stand out or be affordable... this place did neither.

I would not recommend this place if you are going out looking for a special night or amazing steak.
author: Jessica J.

description: Food quality is merely good, not excellent. We had Filet Mignon and the Prime Ribeye. Both nice cuts of meat and nicely prepared, but nothing special. Choices available for side dishes and sauces, are very limited and for the extremely HIGH prices more is expected.  No waiting for a table and perhaps prices are why. Very overpriced.  We have been to other steakhouses in SF venue that are a far better experience.
author: Vicki M.

description:
Here's an old-school steak house, pickles in a jar on the table, loaf of bread as big as your head, quarter pound slab of butter, the whole trip.  Elegant and quiet dining room (beyond the spiffy bar) attached to the Omni Hotel in the SF Financial District.  

This is a good place to go if (speaking as a man) you're feeling your testosterone.  Liveried waiters, steaks up to 28 oz., big martinis, harken back to the sort of environment any self-respecting robber baron would approve of.

I ordered a filet rare, and it was perfect.  Prices are comensurate with what you'd expect for coddled, prime beef.  I've not had an opportunity to try other things, but duck and seafood looked appealing.  Wine list is very good and has a more than adequate range for what you need.  Simply the right way to pamper yourself after a really long day.
author: T D.

description: Wow! Let me start by saying that the service was impeccable! Ty and his team provided us with the best service we've had on this trip to California. The exquisite tenderness and flavor of the filet was incredible, and all of the sides were amazing! The orange fizz cocktail I ordered was delish and refreshing, and the filets we had ordered were prepared perfectly! Everything was delicious and the service was phenomenal! Can't wait to visit Bob's again. Highly recommend.
author: Kelly R.

description: Ate here about 4 times so far... each time the quality was consistently good.  The Bone In Ribeye - Cote de Boeuf is their signature dish and is just absolutely heavenly.   I recommend Medium Rare of course.  The glazed carrot is divine.  Highly recommend - five stars.
author: SHOU LIN C.

description: A bit pricey for drinks...talking $14 for a ketel soda. Steaks on the other hand were solid. Two bottle max if you bring your own (which I've never heard of). Great sides and appetizers as well. Good spot for a guy's night.
author: J S.

description:
wow!  had to write!..
I found an Unexpected culinary treat this weekend at the bar of the Omni Hotel in SF.

Sunday early evening:  around 5:30pm
HAPPY HOUR!
Stella and Anchor Steam on tap.
I went in for a beer before heading up to the room to.....rejuvinate(?)
The guy next to me with a british accent from Pittsburgh, orders a cheeseburger.

This burger arrives and looks amazing.  shiny brioche bun, medium, cheddar, pickles, red onions, tomato, lettuce.
 
I ordered it....... and was JACKED!  no shit...
great burger.    Add the bacon...its a must.
but too make it even more pleasurable....go and get it during "happy hour"....its HALF PRICE!!!!!!
author: Joe F.

description: I love this place so much its on my top 5 places to eat in San Francisco. its a little pricy but worth ever penny.. The staff are very nice and accommodating. Im planning a date night for next weekend just so I can come here...
author: Jennifer G.

description:
I had the regular ribeye, 12 oz, which was pretty good, cooked closer to medium than medium rare. The carrot was abnormally dildo-esque. The baked potato was good but paled in comparison to the one at sundance mining company. The bacon on the potato was OK. I didn't eat dessert but the ice cream did not look particularly good.

I'd go for the Ringside in Portland or any Flemings any day of the week. Sundance Mining Company was in many respects better too.
author: Henry Y.

description: Good overall restaurant, but steak quality is closer to the large franchises than the great steakhouses
author: Arash E.

description: Excellent steak! Service and ambiance were great. I ordered the Kansas City strip and it was excellent at medium rare. Great friends introduced us to this place and we can honestly say its the best steak we've ever had.
author: C. C.

description: bob's is hands down one of my favorite lunch spots. i always skip making a reservation in the restaurant area (which is a little too old school and/or stuffy for me), and instead pop into the bar for lunch. service is extremely friendly and surprisingly quick. my lunch buddies and i are usually able to put back an amazing bob's cobb (with crab, obv) and a glass of red in about 30-40 minutes. the prices are a little steep (about $50 for salad/wine), but well worth the occasional splurge.
author: Connie S.

description:
Breakfast was a nightmare. At a 9-person table we got our meals at widely varying intervals (between 5 & 20 minutes apart!), the eggs Benedict were hard-cooked, the toast came out cold; the avocados were brown, the sunny-up eggs were burnt on the bottom, the service was unfriendly until we complained... and I'm just getting started! The 20% tip wad added automatically and they didn't comp us for any of the bad food. 

This is a high- priced establishment where you should expect a gourmet experience--you get better quality food and service at a place like Denny's. Save your money!!

On the other hand, The Omni Hotel it is connected to was fabulous in every way. We wouldn't like the resaurant's failures to reflect on the hotel...but the hotel and restaurant managers  need to have a serious talk to fix this huge disparity.
author: Joan C.

description:
Great food, great service!

The steak was flavorful and cooked perfectly (we ordered the filet mignon and New York strip, both medium rare).  It came with a glazed carrot and choice of potato. Beats having to order everything separately ala all the other fancy steakhouses!  I mean honestly, if I am paying $50+ for a steak, how much is it going to hurt your bottom-line to include the $1-worth of veggies?!  Way to do it right, Bob's!

Impressive wine list.
4.5 stars!
author: Theresa N.

description:
I am new to San Francisco and after visiting many places in Financial District I decided to search for good steak house. Bob's was an excellent choice. I liked the sunny table next to the window, looking at the street. Their manager Matt was very helpful. He helped me to chose perfect steak that fits well into my nutrition program: New York Strip Steak. It comes with the best prepared carrot I had in my life and with choice of potatoes (i took smashed potatoes). Whole meal was excellent, and I felt excellent whole day, as I think it's very balanced meal.

Also, I liked the ambiance. It's perfect to take a break from work and relax. Sitting there felt me very comfortable, much better then other places I've been visiting around.

I strongly recommend this place. If you like good steak, you have a demanding job, this is a perfect place. Can't wait to try some of the other dishes they serve here.
author: Darko S.

description: Solid, good service, good food, nice presentation for dinner.  Only improvement would be onion rings - they look nice but need to be crispy.  Nice atomosphere.
author: Lawrence L.

description: I was just at Bobs this last weekend for a private event. I have to say that I wasn't expecting this place to be as good as it was. Now I am assuming this because I was forced to go to dinner here for a work function. But as soon as I walked in I was hit with that smell of finely cooked meets that I have only experienced a handful of times. The last good steak I had was in Napa at Rutherfords. The steak at bobs, filet, was very good. Cooked just right and not over seasoned or obviously drenched in butter. I really liked. I almost want to say best steak in SF but I won't... Yet. I want to try Harris steak place too, then I will decide on the best for me. But Bobs was a pleasant surprise and did deliver on flavor for me that night. I will be coming back, but for fun this next time.
author: Cliff B.

description:
The food is good, but portions are enormous.  It's definitely a more stuffy environment, but I enjoyed not having o scream to have a conversation.  If you go, make sure you're hungry cues the serving sizes are huge.  The steaks were cooked perfectly and not smothered with sauces (plain and simple).

The lobster bisque was good and I was so stuff, I couldn't even get to dessert.
author: Eva Y.

description:
I had no idea this place existed!  I don't venture far from my little corner of the Financial District at lunch time.   My friend brought me here for an early birthday celebration.  We shared yummy mini-crab tacos.  Delicious, light, and crispy shells filled with veggies and crab.  The sweet sauce that comes with it is a must.  They're served cold - three small tacos to a plate.  

For entrees, my friend had a fantastic, perfectly cooked petite filet mignon.  Came with glazed carrots and mashed potatoes.  The filet was definitely the star on the plate.  I had the chicken fried rib-eye with peppercorn sauce, and fries.  Fries were ok - will probably get mashed potatoes next time.  The rib-eye was good - huge portion - but I think I will get a regular steak next time.  It was basically a rib eye steak pounded flat and then fried.  Good seasonings and good sauce - but nothing beats a real steak on a plate.  Next time...

Leftovers - bringing home almost a full portion of steak and fries.

No room for dessert.  This was lunch after all!  :)
author: Denise M.

description:
Now... THIS IS ONE FINE STEAKHOUSE!!!!!

Upon your entrance into Bob's the initial impression is spaciousness... very, very high ceilings, and more than enough elbow room between tables. Wood, nice and dark and atmospheric... just the right touch for a steakhouse! Most steakhouses will not have this spaciousness, unless they're located within an older structure. White tablecloths... not necessary for my taste, but that's OK too. 

In my latest visit to Bob's I ordered their Porterhouse (but I have ordered their New York, and Rib-Eye in the past)... this is definitely a Porterhouse upon initial observation! The Porterhouse looked very similar to this ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cj14YLKJk5fWDjYc6auZVg?select=oEv9GdPPYhNWIWf2BbgOKw ). Porterhouse had just the right amount of singed meat on the outside which produced a Porterhouse that ranged from medium at the outer edges to barely rare near the bone. Bob's is not afraid of seasoning the meat... to some palates the seasoning could be a little much. I also like the fact that Bob's leaves some fat on the meat for flavor... Who's afraid of a little bit of fat? This is one helluva piece of meat! 

Everything is of Texas-size here at Bob's. The bread was huge. The potatoes we had, slathered on the side, was of the (s)mashed variety with onions mixed in; and of course there is the signature giganto glazed carrot (now the carrot looked like it was grown with something not natural!). Even the utensils were of the Texas variety!

Can't review the after-dinner items on the menu, mainly because there was no room after every meal here at Bob's! 

For the reviewers complaining about the wait time between appetizers and the main dish... I definitely need the all the time I can get to make room for a twenty-eight ounce steak... don't mind the wait at all! 

Service was excellent... cordial and timely, and most importantly not intrusive. All I ask of any restaurant is... just let me EAT! 

The problem is AFTER consuming such a humongous piece of meat. My son and I WALKED off the meal... all the way down to the Mission district... Dinner? Forget it, had enough already!

Why do I like Bob's over Ruth's Chris or Morton's? Bob's Steakhouse Steaks LOOKs like the meat came from a cow... where Morton's or Ruth's Chris' steaks seems as if they've been on steroids or a cow-growth-hormone! At Morton's especially... a Rib-Eye looks like a New York, which looks like a Filet Mignon, which looks like... And at Ruth's Chris' chrome and glass atmosphere... anytime you consume steak, you've got to have some wood somewhere!

In essence, Bob's above all!
author: r l.

description:
Though I've worked a block away from Bob's for three years, today was my first visit.  Five hours later and I'm still thinking wisftfully about my incredible crab cobb salad.  Big, juicy, fresh pieces of lump crab meat cushioned by a bed of lettuce and adorned with a bevy of attractive neighbors: hard-boiled egg; bacon; blue cheese; avocado; kalamata olives; and tomatoes.  I got the vinagrette on the side and, with a few generous squeezes of lemon, the flavor was just perfect.
I want to go back and do it all over again (with the same exact order) now that I know what I treat I'm in for!  At $18.95 this won't become my regular salad spot, but I'll definitely remember it for a lunchtime splurge.
author: Auburn D.

description:
this review is for the bar area/lounge on the corner or Cal/Montgomery, not the actually restaurant/dinning area.

Not a huge fan,

Drinks/food is pretty overpriced.  It caters to the biz crowd from the Financial District.  Folks that can just throw down the corp credit w/o really thinking much about it.  

Service is OK at beast.  Drinks are not that great.  Bartenders/waiters are nice but not that friendly.    

Atmosphere is def the biz crowd for most of the day.  The bar gets pretty packed and crammed.  

I only been there b/c it's close to work and I usually drink for free.  Would not go out of my way to go  here.
author: Ivan M.

description:
My husband and I work in the financial district and decided to have lunch here at Bob's on Friday.  

we were lucky to be placed in a small room off the main restaurant; which made it quaint and quiet.  We were able to have a lovely conversation speaking in normal tones.

the food, good presentation and tasty.  Yes, I will return and I recommend it to my friends. 
Cheers
author: raven f.

description: Had a martini at the bar before tying the knot! Classy place, great bartender!
author: Jolene R.

description: I really liked this place. It may not be a fancy "Upscale" restaurant but the steak was really good. Casual atmosphere and service was great too. Parking is a bit price if you valet if with the hotel. But if you know the financial district, you'll be able to find street parking.
author: Jowell M.

description:
Best bone-in filet!  Good cocktail. Good wine.  Great service. Very kid friendly. If I had to complain it will be the dessert--average dessert.  Overall, I love this place. 

Cons:  pricey
author: Bayarea K.

description: I dined with three other people on Tuesday evening.  The mood is classic east coast steak house with a good amount of dark wood.  From the beginning, the service was extremely efficient but not intrusive. Most of us started with a salad or appetizer.  I had the blue cheese salad which was more of a chopped salad with a very tasty blue cheese dressing.  The salad was crisp and cold.....perfect.  For the meal, I had the 9 ounce fillet.  It was incredibly tender, no fat or gristle running through, therefore, you could easily eat the entire portion.  It looked like a center cut, fairly round and very thick. I really appreciate good steaks and this one was at or near the top of any I have had in recent memory. The wine list was among the best I have seen and they also had a sale on select 2007 & 2008 wines.  For desert I had the crème brule along with a white desert wine.  I have dined at a many steak houses over the years and whenever I am in SF and in the mood for a steak, this is where I will end up.
author: Rick S.

description: This was our first time at Bob's.  Love 'the carrot' and the bread. Ordered filet mignon medium rare and it was cooked perfectly.  The sides of onion rings and creamed spinach were just so so. The wait staff was very attentive and we will return to this location for dinner again.
author: Carol K.

description:
Cool atmosphere, steaks were pretty good. Be carefull when they bring out your plate, they serve you an enormous carrot that is bigger than your steak.

Pretty good food, but for the price San Francisco has much better options for steak.
author: Matt B.

description: Bob's was a good steak but for the price there are better.  The aged steaks just didn't have the favor on par with others I have tasted.
author: John H.

description:
A business lunch place, no reservations needed as there are tons of tables, black napkins as most business people wear dark pants / skirts, semi formal code, fast and decent food and non-intrusive service.

It was pretty funny as the daily specials were all seafood for the day we were having lunch... seafood special at a chop house!

I had the Filet Mignon on medium rare. It came slightly more cooked than it should be but was still tender and good. Side mashed potatoes was huge and the cinnamon carrot was a good light touch.

Service was pretty prompt and to the point. No smalltalk as they know people come here for the privacy. They served the dishes fast. And the fact that no background music was perfect.

Lots of space apart from each table, perfect to have private conversations without others accidentally joining.
author: T L.

description:
How completely disappointing !  Bobs ruined our celebration night... really a big let down. Serioulsy the WORST service we have ever received, which is particularly painful for a restaurant that charges $54 for a steak - should be first class.....

When we were planning our dining night out we looked up Bobs (we were staying at the Omni Hotel) but no where were the prices posted online or anywhere.  We walked up outside to see the menu.... no menu or prices posted....  we knew we were going to splurge so we decided to give it a try...

First when we asked for a window seat.... they weren't busy at the time, but the manager told us they didnt have any tables available for two with a window view.... I was like OK....we get that.    But he sat us at a table that litrerally had another table 20 inches away....    A single guy came in immediately after us and at first the manager was going to sit him at the table next to us (meaning at our table) and the guy was like NO WAY.... the manager found him a cute window table !  I am like WELL THATS KIND OF CRAPPY, that we were not offered that table.  but... I understand perhaps the manager didnt see it....

We open the menu and discover HOLY SMOKES!  $54 for a steak and potatoes?  That is steep... so I am thinking  THIS MUST BE AN AMAZING STEAK....  but after our waiter got my glass of wine... he was missing in action..... no bread at our table... and the single guy at the window seat that came in after us is on his tablet (not looking out the window) already enjoying his salad. We havent even ordered yet.


They sat another couple at our table and the older gentlement is conducting business loudly on his cell phone with the ringer (which is set like a traditional old phone) is ringing non stop thru the rest of our meal.   LOVELY.....

Finally our waiter shows up.... we order steaks.  My wife orders medium rare, I order medium.  the waiter is walking away and I ask him if we can have bread and his only nods while he is walking away... 

We did not see that waiter agian until we were leaving the restaurant.

Our steaks arrive, they dap a teaspoon of everything you want on your baked potatoe then walk away with the condiments ---  I was grateful that we still had butter from the bread.   My wifes steak is cooked perfectly BUT mine is medium RARE... the middle is just not cooked at all....practically bleeding...... I wait and wait and finally flagged down a really nice waitress who takes my steak back.    

My steak comes back and it was as if they never even bothered putting it back on the grill.... it is still literally rubbery bleeding in the middle.... NOW, NOW I have finally had it!  I asked for the manager and talked to him about how disaapointed we were, he made excuses (lied about the table being occupied that they sat the single guy) and asked me if I wanted a new steak...  I told him at this point NO I do not want another steak, I would pay for my wifes steak, but I would not be paying for mine.  He said fine, there will be no bill for anything and then he had a waiter remove my plate entirely (not even letting me eat the dry baked potatoe).... he should have at least let me eat something, he just had my plate removed.  I came really looking forward to this steak, hungry and I left furstrated and STARVING.... at least they had M and M's in the mini bar!

We finally saw the waiter again and he acted frustrated and said "no bill" and walked away.

So.... here we are celebrating and expecting to splurge on a nice steak.... we didnt eat lunch expecting this nice meal ---- and I leave without eating and with having a big damper on our evening.

I am sorry, for a place that charges $54 for a steak ? this was the worst trainwreck and poor excuse for an upper scale restaurant.  They should be ashamed.

I will be copying review to the Omni as well as Bob's owner....
author: Dyan B.

description: How can this restaurant get away with exorbitant prices, even by San Francisco standards, with such pedestrian food? The steaks were good enough, no better than dozens of other places, but the side dishes were inedible. Soggy carrots, McDonald's french fries, gloppy salad dressings, and soup obviously full of yesterday's leftovers with strangely mixed flavors. $30 lunches without drinks is just a bit. The bus boy (older man) continuously reached across us to deliver utensils and remove plates. Whew-what an over rated place.
author: Shelly D.

description: I can only speak for the bar in the Omni adjoining this restaurant. The six of us ordered drinks, of which 3-4 were beers. Tab: 90 dollars. Are you kidding me? I understand if this was the Top o the Mark or The ritz Carlton, but the Omni? Please... None of us will be back...
author: Jim B.

description:
The rib-eye steak here was very average......the ambience was ok but not
spectacular..The place just didn't do it for me...

Deserts were awful..Poor selection and quality...

Way overpriced for what u get..  Outback will give u a better steak and ambience at half price.
author: Raider J.

description: I came here for lunch with co-workers and had a nice meal.  While they all ordered the chicken-fried rib eye, I decided to go the "lite" route and ordered the scallops.  They were perfectly cooked and really tasty.  The dish comes with ratatouille, which wasn't the best thing I've had, but considering I hate every ingredient in there (squash, bell pepper, onion)  it was actually decent enough to eat.  I would definitely order a steak next time since they are a "steakhouse".  The peanut butter ice-cream for dessert was awesome and the highlight of the meal.  Our waiter had great service and I like the ambiance, so I'll give this place another try sometime in the near future.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Very pricey - just because they are in a high-end hotel.  My friend and I had filet mignon at $29 each for a 6oz piece with potatoes and glazed carrots on the side.  The filet was okay, not fantastic.  The glazed carrots were meh.  The smashed potatoes were so-so.  Their bread and butter was very good though!

First thing I didn't like about this place is that our waiter was pushy - he kept offering us the day's special and everything else to upgrade our order.  We wanted soup but the soup of the day was onion and we did not like that and he offered that he could have lobster bisque made especially for us!  Ha!  Then he asked if we wanted to order sides, that was after we told him all we wanted was the steak.

Then the most insulting part was that three times, waiters came to our table asking us if we were done eating as they wanted to take our plates away - and this happened while my friend still has some steak on her plate and I still had the potatoes and still had my knife and fork wide apart from each other on my plate!  There was no reason to rush us because the place was half-empty.

A really classy restaurant with the prices they charged would have just let us linger and when we asked for the bill is when they would clear our table.

Was it because we used an OpenTable Spotlight certificate and wanted to get rid of us fast?  I can't answer that one.

But I really think it was rude of them to keep coming to our table asking if we were ready to have it cleared.

And for that I give this place ONE star - only because there is no such thing as NO STAR - otherwise I would rate this place NO STAR.
author: Carmen F.

description:
Was in town staying at the Omni for Bay2Breakers and managed to stop in after for lunch and catch up on the Laker game as a friend of mine comes here a lot so we went. This review is based on the lunch offerings.

The good? The service, classy interior and the food quality earn high marks. Loved the calamari and the chicken wings were really spicy, even when the chicken wings itself were decent.

The bad?  Prices! 
$20 for a burger? Really? It better had been Kobe beef I was eating cause it was not mentioned in the menu as such. There's also those Kobe beef sliders (3) for a buck more. Seriously?  Everything was over $10.

I'm from SoCal and for $20, I'd rather stick to the Father's Office burger and pocket the $8 I could be saving - and yes, the FO burger is definitely worth the $12. The Bob's burger was good, but not $20 good. I was expecting extremely juicy and tender beef. Heck, just gimme an In-N-Out burger and I'd be happy.

It's good and perhaps the steaks are excellent but at the prices they charge, I'll pass on spending $50 for lunch. Definitely for the once Wall Street crowd.
author: Raymond S.

description:
I've been here a few times and also their location in Dallas a few. Steaks are cooked to perfection every time. Their jumbo shrimp cocktails are amazingly fresh and crisp. And they really are jumbo. I'm talkin' 16/20's.. maybe even bigger. The food is always excellent. So good it makes you wanna slap somebody!

The wait staff is very good and ambiance is nice. I'll always come back. They do it right.

Quit f'in around.. COTE de BOEUF.. all day.. mmm mmm
author: David D.

description: Nothing to extraordinary the steak i ordered was ok, the flavor was not great, cooked to  what i asked. For what i paid i expected moor
author: Joe J.

description: The service was very slow on a Sunday night, despite the relative emptiness of the restaurant, and the food was just marginal.
author: Kristen O.

description: I'm not a big fan of red meat so when I dined here I ordered the pork chops, which were very well prepared.  Two of the others ordered some massive steaks which they enjoyed very much, and another in our party ordered the broiled salmon which was definitely on the dry side.  Despite the dry salmon, our dining experience was good and the waitstaff took good care of us.  For dessert the four of us split the brownie sundae and the creme bruelee, both which were great.  The dining room is semi-formal and appears to be well cared for so it doesn't look dated or run-down at all.
author: Kent W.

description:
Known for their "Cote de Boeuf" aka bone in ribeye and phallic carrot.  Strangely, I was anticipating this glazed piece of veggie over the steak and it didn't disappoint.  It seriously looks as big, long, and shiny as the pics.

9p seating on NYE and service was nice.  Started off with the Jumbo Shrimp cocktail, but sadly the shrimp was overcooked.  Shared the Beefsteak Tomato and Red Onion salad with blue cheese and vinaigrette dressing.  Pretty tasty, filling, and definitely worth sharing.

His bone in ribeye was prepared as requested and the entire piece of prime meat was devoured.  Carrot reminded me of sweet potatoes.  Smashed potatoes, baked potato and creamed spinach were boring and just not that yummy.  My Maryland crabcakes lacked lump meat.  Sort of a disappointment.

Decor wasn't as outdated as I envisioned after reading the other reviews.  It's in the Omni Hotel and in my opinion, steakhouses can get away with the burgundy and oak look.  Here's my take on Bob's.  If you want a bone-in ribeye, this is your place, but don't expect too much from the side dishes.  Prices are comparable with other local steak spots, but if you're looking for a more well-rounded meal, you might want to go somewhere else.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
To, "It Was The Night Before Christmas"
It was christmas night and all thru the city not a restaurant was availaible not even a hope...
I was in charge of a last minute res to fulfill a happy dinner and make Christmas a sucess for my friend and I together....
Then Bob's popped up on opentable.com and I made the call and all my unhappiness was a cloud that was gone.
So now we're seated eating steak tonight when everyone is thinking when will the stock market shimmy or perhaps shake  !

Bobs steak house is simply an old style steak house. It's not hyp or cool, just a good place to eat. I had the smallest fillet of three, still big and wonderful and he had the Ribeye which he definitely enjoyed because he basically inhalled it .

It's perfect when you just want to eat a good steak alone and not have to be bothered with the who's who and/or am I dressed to impress .
Food ...3.5 stars
Service ...3.5 stars
Decor...  3 stars, dark wood
Prices ...30's- 50's for the steaks
author: Katherine N.

description:
I'm picking the meh New York out of my teeth right now.  There are gaps! 

Tea, soda, and two plates of meh steak make for $80?  I don't think so.  BIG ole hole in the wallet.  The doorman (love him!) told me Bob's dry-ages for 3 days, but there was a gap in communication.  The waiter said they only wet aged...I can believe it.   The difference between the New York and the Filet was not that pronounced.  They both needed more marbling and crust, though. 

And only three cuts of beef were offered.  Really?  This a "steak and chop house"?  That's a hole in the marketing if I've ever seen one.  If I'd spent $80 at The Fat Lady, I'd have left the table stuffed full and in love.  Instead, it's  like there's... a hole where lunch was.  Ah, frustrated amour....

Mind the gap!
author: Plot T.

description: My husband and I spent a few nights at the Omni and every night, we finished our day off with cocktails at Bob's.  I loved the complimentary peanut/trail mix and hubby was happy with the service.  We pretty much sat at the same table each night with great views of the goings-on California St.  Pricey and at times, VERY busy and loud...however, the "charge it to your room" convenience paired with eager cocktail waiters & waitresses made Bob's worth the extra buck.
author: Beth R.

description:
Got into town on business and decided to eat early.  Was by myself, so wanted a steakhouse where I could sit at the bar.  My hotel concierge suggested Bob's, as it's only a few blocks away from my hotel.

Arrived at Bob's and went right to the bar.  There was a single seat, so I grabbed it.  bartender was busy, so I waited patiently for him to bring the wine-by-the-glass menu.  I ordered a glass of cab.

He brought the wine and took my order.  9oz filet and a baked potato, thanks.  I also saw it came with some carrot dish.  More on that in a moment.

The waiter has to go get the food.  No runners at Bob's, so the service was a bit slow.  I expected my salad within about 5 mins or so.  Took closer to 15 or 20 mins.  I'm not in any rush, but still...

Salad came.  He topped it with pepper.  Too much cabbage in the tossed salad for my liking.   And the ranch dressing was voluminous and drenching the entire salad.  Points off.

I found it odd that there was no bread offered.  What kind of steakhouse doesn't serve some piping-hot bread?

Anyway, he took the plate away and almost immediately the steak arrived.  It was accompanied by a baked potato and the bartender did the presentation of sour cream, chives, bacon and cheese.   Do I want any?  Sure.  He skimped a bit on the cheese and bacon, but did fine on the sour cream.

The steak was flavorful.  Not phenomenal, but not too bad either.  The steak was the highlight of the meal.  The potato was not bad once everything was mixed in.  And that carrot.  Holy cow!  That thing was bugs bunny huge!  Just massive and covered in something sweet.  I would have preferred it without the sweet stuff.

I took my time and enjoyed.  The bartender NEVER came over to check on me, so it's a good thing I'm low maintenance.

I quickly pulled out my credit card while he was in view and he took care of the bill.  A glass of wine, a steak, a side salad and tip = $77.  Expensive, but if I had ordered room service I would have had about the same.

I won't go back, considering all the great steaks in San Francisco - when I'm back that is.
author: Todd M.

description: I feel conflicted. I just went to Alexander's SF and then Bob's yesterday. Even though the caliber of steaks served at Alexander's is top notch, you cannot scough at Bob's beef. The selection is great, and I am certain that the Cote de Boeuf aka the Bone-In Ribeye is the best in the city. The juiciness of the steak along with the sweet, fat marbling is all you can ask for. The Bone-In Kansas City aka Bone-In NY Strip ain't too shabby either. Which is best in SF? Bob's or Alexander's? Tough choice. I'll get back to you after I do some more research...
author: Al L.

description:
My buddy and I strolled into Bob's around 7:30 on a Friday with no reservation. There was a 30 min wait so we grabbed a couple of seats at the bar and continued our happy hour drinking with a couple of Chimay drafts. 

Most people there seemed to be enjoying a formal dinner or on a date so as a courtesy to everyone else we requested a table away from everyone else so we could continue our drinking and happy hour banter. We both went with the 16oz filet and OMFG! This was the single best steak I have ever had in my life, it could have been because I'd been drinking for about 4 and a half hours straight and was starving, but regardless it was amazing. After dinner we headed back over to the bar to finish our bottle of wine then both headed home... Drunk, Happy and very full of perfectly prepared Filet Mignon!
author: Thel D.

description:
Eugy seems to really like this place and I really don't know why... We came here for date night and I felt really out of place, surprisingly. I felt like I was transported back in time somehow. The restaurant is really outdated. I mean REALLY outdated. And so where the other dining patrons. Me and Eugy could have been some of those folks grandkids or great grandkids. Of course, there is absolutely nothing wrong with this, but for date night, I want to go someplace hip, not someplace where people with hip replacements hang out... I know, that's mean. Oh well.. 

I had the filet mignon cooked medium with the baked potato and a side of creamed spinach. The steak was ok, but nothing amazing. I HATED the carrot. Yuck. The baked potato was nice but I wish I could have kept the "fixins" tree on my table. I would have eaten all the bacon though, so that's probably not a good idea. The creamed spinach was disgusting. Ate one bite and couldn't take another. 

For dessert I had the key lime pie. It was wonderful. Really wonderful. Best part of the meal probably. 

For most of the meal though I was overcome with anxiety. There was a HUGE moth flying around the room and it swooped right down into my hair a few times. I am deathly afraid of moths and to be attacked by one at dinner was unsettling. I could barely sit through dinner. I kept following the moth with my eyes to make sure that it didn't attack me again. Not cool... Eugy got a good laugh though. Cha...
author: Jen D.

description:
In the Omni Hotel - I usually have the 1/2Lb Glazed Carrot and the 1/2 Lb Smashed Potatoes at the bar with a beer. And yes, i leave a pound heavier. Yum.

Pints of Beer are $7 which is really high for anywhere i know of. Its a high end hotel but... Thats hwy robbery. And HH doesnt start until 5 sharp.
author: Adam X.

description: The steak was delicious. The portions were generous. The service was solid. No complaints here.
author: Gary A.

description:
Ah Bob, 

How do I love thee....let me count the ways.... 

First Star for Filet that will melt in your mouth 
Second Star for stocking Rochambeau 
Third Star for not smothering your steak with sauces to hide an inability to cook like most places 
Fourth Star for not being a la carte 
Fifth star for being close enough to walk to when a vendor wants to go out to lunch. 

mmmmmmm, post lunch coma after Bob's....like afterglow without the awkward breakfast conversation.
author: B G.

description: Good solid steakhouse. Good menu, well-prepared. My wife and I were not too hungry and decided to share an entree, and the server plated everything on separate dishes with no fuss....much appreciated. Food was first rate for us as well as our guests. Excellent service!
author: Gary M.

description: Ordered a rib eye and it was bland.  I was informed by the waiter they don't season the meat.  If I'm paying over $50 for a steak dinner I want the chef to season it and make it memorable.  Not impressed.
author: Doug W.

description:
you know the old saying, a man's best friend is a dog or beer (coughs) and that a woman's best friend are diamonds and her sweets, but now, i proclaim a valid statement that i want to tell the YELP community like Dr. King's "I have a dream ... "

sure, a girl's gotta have her weekly, monthly, or whatever sweets, but THIS girl, that's me ... lol, has gotta have her meat ... RAWR!

it was one of those days when someone asks you, "what are you craving?"

me? STEAK ... 

thanks to a dear friend down in LA who absolutely LOVES to eat, as he highly suggested this place, so i must give him some props! it was pretty darn good ... and i couldn't have asked for a better dinner .. my dear friend who treated me to the carnelian room (http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?userid=EKdyI4jpUF29YtPkKiCtcg&q=carnelian) LAST year, took me to bob's .. :) i love how my friend, R loves to eat ... i swear, this boy can EAT, but this time, he ordered a weenie dish, or so my dear friend in LA calls it, which i have to agree ...
the 19 oz filet mignon.. and ME? yes ... a 22 ozer ... :))  the question is, did i finish it? what do u think?

winner gets a chocolate chip cookie with milk with that..

the crowd was very much the FiDi crowd ... located inside the Omni Hotel on California // Montgomery in the heart of the Financial District of Ess Eff.
